WHAT?   Anyway, I don't like pho. Never did, never will. So obviously I didn't try the pho here but I did get the vermicelli with egg rolls and pork, as well as the bi cuon and those two were okay. The vermicelli was sweeter than the ones in LA for some reason (maybe it's that fish sauce) and for $9, I guess it's okay. 2 small rolls of bi cuon for $5 was a blasphemy to me because back in the LA or even the OC, we could get 4 rolls for the same price that tasted much better. But, the ones here were still decent so I'm not complaining.  Overall: Food is good, prices could be better but hey since they don't have much competition, I guess it's okay.

The food was so good!  My friend and I both had the brisket pho and we shared the crispy spring rolls.  The pho was excellent!  The brisket was tender and delicious.  The pho broth was very tasty!  The spring rolls were also very good.  We never felt ignored because the service was fantastic.  Everyone working there was very attentive, polite, and quick.  I would definitely go back.  Perfect food on a cold night, too!
Always amazing service! Always amazing pho! Add veggies to a meat dish! The spring rolls A1 & A6 are the best in town!!! We are now here on a weekly basis.

I was in the area one Sunday and decided to have lunch here. I looked at the name and thought....oh my...this is probably gonna be a mistake. Who names their restaurant something that corny and have good food!??  Boy, was I wrong!   The owner was very polite and nice, he was constantly checking up on us while we ate to make sure we got everything. The pho was ....."unphogettable"!!!! .....  I must say this is the best pho I've had since Seattle.  They had the pho out in like, 5 mins also...which is how long pho SHOULD take to make at a restaurant level.  I was very satisfied with the service and the food.
Don't ever go here. The pho broth taste so sweet with all the msg. This probably the last time I will be here

I called ahead to order dinner for home.  I'd been here before,  and although it didn't stand out,  it wasn't bad..  That I remember.  I asked for something that was on the menu,  but was told it wasn't so got something else.  When I got there,  there was no one in the store,  and I didn't feel like my presence was making them too excited..   I ignore those things quickly  though and brushed it off.    I got my food,  and it was chicken pad Thai.  It was really dry..  Like crispy noodles burned to the bottom of a pan dry. So that was disappointing.  I didn't finish more than half of it,  and unfortunately probably won't be back.

The restaurant had really friendly service. Great on refills my drink never went under 2/3 . It was fairly busy, yet my food came out pretty fast. The portions are huge and tasted amazing. Any questions i had about the menu were answered quickly with no hesitation. Plan on going back very soon!
Great spot for lunch. Very easy pay at the counter type spot but amazing food. Best pho!!

Love love love this place.  We went in because our regular pho place was closed. I feel bad because we are now regular customers and go in at least once a week.  We get the same thing each time and they know our order.  They are super friendly and more than happy to explain how to eat the food if you new (wrapping egg rolls and using the sauces). Not to mention clean clean!  the portions are huge and enough for our family of three to share two dishes.  The soda with lime is amazing!  You will not be disappointed.

Super not good. Ordered shrimp spring rolls and duck soup. The rolls smelled like my dogs infected ear. The duck in the soup was nearly inedible. Didn't finish everything just drank the broth and ate the noodles.  Worst $20 ever spent.

When have you ever visited an establishment who's greeting to you is "Thank you for bringing your nice family"  LOVE  This is noodle soup served with love.  Its also the only place we've ever eaten Pho, so I don't feel qualified to comment on the authenticity of the food, but it tastes so good, so fresh, so delicious, that even if it were not authentic, I would still give it 5 stars.  The last trip we made was an incredibly hot day, I ordered a lime soda (soda water and an abundance of fresh squeezed lime juice, with a lime wedge and ice....so refreshing!) with one of the salads...rice vermicelli with shrimp sausage.  Absolutely perfect for a hot day.  I enjoyed immensely.  Also, at the end of our meal, the owner came walking in and whether he actually recognized us or not, I have no idea (we've only been 2 or 3 times before) but he ACTED like he knew us and came walking up and again greeted us with "Thank you for bringing your family today".  Gotta love it.

The pho here is the best in Phoenix area. It will rivals many pho houses in California. The Vietnamese community is growing. And so is the taste for good pho. The broth, in the pho, here is all from scratch and no shortcuts. You can really taste the balance of flavors of anise, cinnamon, etc. If your not familiar with Vietnamese food. You don't have to worry. The service staff will politely educate you in the proper way to enjoy any dish. If your looking for new pho house or looking to try Vietnamese food. Come here

My favorite dining option inside Mekong. I love the vegetarian bun. Lots of noodles and lettuce topped with crunchy egg rolls. It comes with a dark, flavorful sauce that substitues for the traditional fish sauce. I would like to see another topping besides eggs rolls like a faux (pho?) meat.   Tofu spring rolls and the accompanying peanut sauce is delicious. I can't specifically comment on any other dishes, but the family that I've brought here all love their dishes.  Service is so friendly and welcoming. UnPhogettable is one of those places where you feel like you're dining in someone's home.
We love this place! Great place especially if you are vegan. We like the harvest rolls and the vegetable pho.

It's always a pleasure coming in for pho here. Owner, staff and food is always exceptional! I've been coming in for lunch with my co-workers and always rant to others who never had Pho.   I always order the #8 with a Thai tea.

Our waitress was very friendly and attentive. We got there right before the dinner rush on Friday evening and we were seated right away.   They have a quite a few different options on the menu and different plates to pick from.   We ended up getting one kids chicken pho with rice noodles, one chicken pho, one seafood pho, and a grilled fish dish that came with a small salad and rice.   The pho's came out quickly and the fish plate came out a few minutes later. My chicken pho was just decent. The broth could've been better and it definitely lacked flavor. There were about 5 pieces of chicken in my bowl for $9.95.  The seafood pho had two pieces of shrimp, two pieces of calamari, and two pieces of shrimp cake. This was $10.95. Really wish it would have had more shrimp....   The fish plate had a small serving of white rice and a small salad. The fish though, was decently sized and it tasted good.   There was no soy sauce or forks at the table so we had to hunt down the waitress. She did come around for refills though and she did check up on us a few times.   We spent $45 for two regular sized phos, one grilled fish plate, one lemonade, and one kids chicken pho.   I wasn't too impressed with the pho as I've definitely had better tasting broth. They were also kind of skimpy with the meats. I've been to other places where they give you a lot more meat and the phos even cheaper. Maybe will be back if in the area.

I love Pho. I love mekong plaza and its potential.  Anyway- unPhogettable is a nice place to spend your Saturday after stocking up on Asian groceries. What I like about this place is how personable and amazingly friendly the wait staff are. Service was impeccable.  The pho was great- me, my sisters and grandma got a variation of different noodle dishes. We did one with seafood, one with tendon, and one with rare flank steak. We also ordered thai iced tea and vietnamese coffee. All of those were good, but not the best. One thing that I didn't like very well were the fresh spring rolls. I am used to the pho places in Atlanta serving fresh spring rolls with mint inside, and with bigger pieces of shrimp and meat.  So overall- food was okay, but service was amazing.

I mean, the place isn't TOTAL garbage. But frankly, I've been to better pho places. Places where the meat portions aren't so skimpy in the pho soups, and the vegetables served are diverse and multi textured. Also, the broth needs to be abundant and not skimpy either.  That's the thing, this place may have decent pho broth, but the fact that they provide so little quantity in the bowl that arrives for the price makes me want to make the extra drive westward towards central Phoenix to hit up a better Pho place. Or head south to one of the plentiful pho places in Chandler.  Then there's the vegetables. See, Vietnamese food is about textures. And vegetables are a HUGE part of Vietnamese cuisine. For instance, in the pho that I order from here, the vegetable dish that you're supposed to dunk into the soup, it really just comes with bean sprouts and basil, the two cheapest vegetables that a restaurant can provision to its customers. What about cilantro? That's cheap, why can't there be a plentiful amount of that on the vegetable dish? What about the infamous "sawtooth herb" that more authentic Vietnamese restaurants will carry?   So, authenticity. That's a big one. And it's hard to talk about "authenticity" because let's face it, Vietnamese cuisine as we know it in the USA is very "southern Vietnam", which is really a collection of Vietnamese and French influence. American too, if the Vietnamese food is from Saigon (which was occupied by the US during the Vietnam war).   I bring up authenticity because this place really doesn't hammer it for me. It seems like they take all the cheapest parts of American-perceived Vietnamese cuisine and serve it to you. A great example is their noodle dishes that come with lettuce. The better restaurants will serve "green leaf lettuce" and not iceberg. Iceberg is cheap, lacks nutrition and frankly doesn't taste good. Also, the lack of mint in these dishes makes me scratch my head as to why the restaurant almost deliberately holds itself back.  The only thing I can possibly think of is that the restaurant is trying to cater to a specific demographic of customer that devalues things like green leaf lettuce, mint, sawtooth herb. I don't buy the idea that the restaurant doesn't have the financial resources to provision these basic herbs that can literally be bought walking distance from Mekong Market in the same shopping plaza.  To end the review on a positive note, I will say this: It may have been smart for the restaurant to hire on servers that speak fluent English, however, part of me wonders why there is a need for that in the 21st century. Since everyone has a smartphone or at least an Internet connection, even newcomers to Vietnamese food can quickly run a Google search to determine what Vietnamese food is all about, and know upon eating at Unphogettable that this restaurant really isn't the place for a true Pho experience.

The pho and Thai tea were great. I'd maybe prefer a "fast food" variant, since the pho, drink, and tip were about $16 - kinda a lot for a work lunch... but it WAS great food! Also, our server showed us the "right" way to eat pho with the sauces - thanks for the tip, it was yummmmmmy!

I have been here a couple of times and I'll most likely be back because I love that I can trust the meatballs to be GF but probably just for takeout due to poor service and a server spilling soup resulting in burns.   Food: I order the #1 Pho and A1 spring rolls with shrimp & pork. The pho is pretty good here and it's one of the only places that I can safely eat the beef meatballs knowing they are gluten free so that's nice. The pho is definitely the star dish here... spring rolls are OK but probably wouldn't order again.   Service: I don't expect a lot as far as service goes at any Vietnamese restaurant around town, however I would expect that when the server spills your piping hot bowl of pho all over the table and onto your lap and burns you that they at least wipe up the soup that is all over the table (or maybe bring you extra napkins or a towel to do so without having to be asked). Also, if I was an owner/manager and my server were to do so, I would be a little bit apologetic and maybe offer a discount or comp something... just a thought considering the fact that a significant amount of soup was spilled on a customers lap causing burns (I would post a photo to show but they are in places not appropriate for Yelp). They did give us a $4 discount on a $55 bill after we mentioned the spilled soup, but regardless... I get accidents happen. But typically it would (and should be) handled better.

Incredible.  I eat Vietnamese food in many cities and this is the best.  I usually order the same dish and have come to recognize if fresh ingredients are used.  This restaurant is great for quality and flavor of the food, clean and fantastic staff who are friendly and know their menu.  You will love it.

By far, this is one of the best Pho restaurants I've been to. Really friendly customer service, awesome food. The pho has no oil floating... healthy dining... Hands down, I give this place five stars... Please check out this place some time.

The pho was ok. Nothing really stood out. The service was really good. I usually order rare steak on the side with tendon. Why did they charge me 50 cents to have my steak on the side? If I knew that was the cost of labor then I would had requested it inside my bowl. 3 Star for the pho but 5 star for the service.

I wasn't super hungry but wanted a little snack. I ended up getting the A2 fresh rice paper rolls with Vietnamese pork sausage served with house special sauce. Great snack if you're not very hungry and want something to hold you over.
Best pho in the area. period.  Especially useful to soothe a sore throat or clear sinuses.

Craving pho on a Sunday morning, my friends and I decided to drive 20 mins to the only pho place available....this one. Location was cute and convenient, and attached to the shopping center's grocery market. When we walked in, it was extremely busy or anything so we were seated right away and given drinks.   For appetizers we ordered the spring rolls and the egg rolls. Disappointing. The spring rolls are a very easy dish to make, noodles, veggies, meat and sometimes you add shrimp......no, the noodles weren't cooked all the way, the meat was tough and dry, and the veggies weren't fresh, pretty sure the lettuce came out of a bag.  Not to mention the peanut sauce just tasted like straight up peanut butter, that's not how its remotely supposed to taste. The eggrolls were also subpar.  When it came to the entree I got a beef pho with flank, tendon and a few other meats. First thing I notices was that the broth was a lot more clear than any other pho I'd eaten. Rest assured, it tasted just like it looked, hot water! I drowned it in sriracha, hoisen and extra lime just to make it taste better. Meat again was dry just like the spring rolls had been. I was sad.....I just wanted decent pho and this was not it.   Not to mention one of my friends found a tiny piece of a plastic wrapper in her dish. Cute name, cute place.....food no bueno.

I don't know I haven't been coming to this place! Very tasty Vietnamese food and good service every time. The menu is large. The prices are a little higher than the average Vietnamese restaurant, but it is worth it! The average for entrees are $10 plus. Will continue to come back! Try the grilled chicken with rice! Yum!

Most horrible I've ever had!  Over-cooked noodles, bland base and the manager/owner happened to stop by and asked how was everything, after I told him, he walked away saying or doing nothing.   Overpriced and bad food.  I am never eating there ever again.
Pretty much a regular here. They know when I don't come often lol. Pho is great here even the rice dishes are good. All the veggies are fresh. Try this place you won't be disappointed!
The food and serivce was great- very fast service.

I came here a few times already and I can already say that my fav dishes here is the vietnamese spring rolls and well-done beef pho.. the staff is very friendly and it seems like a very clean restaurant. Only complaint is that the spring rolls are kinda small, but that's it. A bowl of pho ranges around $7-8, so price is pretty average. But as far an quantity, you will get plenty of beef, there's no skimping of meat in that area. The broth used is flavorful and has great aroma.   The owners seem like they really pride themselves in their food and service, and that to me is a good sign that they are always front and center of what's going on.I like how it's in the middle of the Mekong plaza, so I can get a bunch of shopping and lunch in while I'm in the area.   Good stuff!

This is my go to spot on the East side for pho. The service is fast, polite, and consistent. It normally takes only but a few minutes to be served your food after ordering! They also keep the place clean and organized, and are very good about remembering repeat customers! I would highly recommend this spot and go at least once or twice a month myself.
This place will always be one of my top favs. They're clean, efficient, and always serve with a smile. A personal favorite that I would recommend is P4 (pho with the brisket). It's delicious. :)
It is ok, the meat is a bit chewy, the broth was nice.  At $10-11 per bowl, it is pricey.
Amazing Pho broth is so rich and delicious. I never really eat the meat in pho so I can't judge. Staff is very attentive.

UnPhogettable- a poem Trying new things can be oh so frightful so it helps to have owners that are oh so delightful Start out with springs rolls to begin the meal, I liked the peanut sauce so much that I let out a squeal! And ah the pho, the main show if you will,  both my tummy and soul it did fill. I've also had their chicken dishes a time or two, those are quite good if soup's not for you. The lighting is dim and the tables lack in style, but once you get past that you'll be there a while.

$10 for mediocre pho? No thanks. You're basically paying for the convenience of eating next to Mekong Supermarket. Nobody should be paying over $9 MAX for a bowl of pho, it's outrageous.  Service and the restaurant itself was nice. The cell signal kind of sucks all throughout Mekong Plaza, if you are indoors. (I'm AT&T.)  To be fair, the Viet broken rice plate place across from Unphogettable is also super expensive, but their rice plates are SOOOO good.  On the other hand, Unphogettable's pho is totally forgettable, nothing to write home about, and wayyy too expensive for pho.  Their name is a cute pun though.
Pretty good. Nice decor,but a little dark.  reasonable wait time for food.

My favorite Vietnamese noodle place in the area. All of the soups are great and the price is reasonable. Spring rolls appear to be made to order and not prepared ahead of time and refrigerated. Service is prompt, the restaurant is a quick in and out for families. If you've had enough of pho, the bun bo hue an the duck leg soup are great. Along with all of the vermicelli bowls. The grilled pork is particularly good.   My only gripe is that they don't offer the kids pho for carry out.

Update 1/12/12  Gave it another try because one feller on here said the egg noodle-wonton dish was the best thing he ate all year, and it was their special, so...  THAT was the best thing you ate all year!?  Pretty tasteless watery broth, and ingredients were pretty tasteless too, and sparse leaves, and over-priced - $8.50, I think it was - too.    1 1/2 rounded up to 2.

My bowl of Pho Ga was served in less than 5 minutes from taking my seat. I've never experienced service that was so fast, attentive and beautifully mastered! The flavors were phonominal and they don't skimp down on the portion of meat you get. A lucky find, Truly unPhogettable

Having owned a restaurant for 15 years, I notice everything when I dine and consequently, I am very picky. I am completely at ease and delighted by this restaurant. I really appreciate the freshness of their food and recognize that they do not cut corners on their ingredients. Their broths are WONDERFULLY flavorful. I usually choose a vegetarian dish and my husband likes seafood. We eat here at least once a week and have never been disappointed. Do try a Vietnamese dessert for a fun and delicious experience.  (BTW, they cater to those who must follow a gluten free diet).  The decor is attractive: a lot of windows, black and white photography, pendant lamps, two flat screened televisions on mute, American music at an unobtrusive volume, and what I really like --- the place is exceedingly clean, including the bathrooms!   The owners of Unphogettable are a married couple, who work very hard and have the most hospitable personalities. They not only make the environment pleasant for their guests, but have  created a good working atmosphere, as is evidenced by the happiness of their employees.   In closing, I couldn't be more enthusiastic in my recommendation of Unphogettable.

I cannot say enough good things about this place! The food is amazing and the customer service is probably the best I've ever experienced. Every time my boyfriend and I dine here the owner visits with us and asks how we are, etc. I've only had Pho at a couple of places in town so I can't speak to the authenticity but it tastes amazing and fresh every time. Places that make good food and offer the kind of customer service these places do (and family owned is always a plus for me!) are just priceless. UnPhogettable is always worth the drive to Mesa.

My favorite local Pho place! The service is always so fast even when it is packed.   Sometimes there is a short wait for a table as it can get very busy but this time we were sat right away. We ordered chicken Pho which comes with side plates of your standard bean shoots, jalapeños, lime, etc. They have hoisin sauce available as well.   The broth isn't the best I've had but still really good!   Be sure to check out the market it's attached to as it has so good deals on produce and other items you wouldn't find at other markets
I love this place!!!!!! I get the S1!!!! It is so good!!!! I dream about this place!!!! They are quick too get you in and out! If you like PHO U have to try this place!
By Far, Our Favorite Vietnamese Restaurant in East Valley. Service is fast, dependable, and restaurant is clean. Restrooms are clean, thank you. Food is outstanding.

I am so disappointed with this place. I'm sorry but why is this place still in business? First off, I walked in and the vibe was not friendly. The staff here honestly doesn't speak at all, not even basic etiquette...   I took a peek at the menu and I was very astonish at how much they charge for a bowl of slice beef pho. 9.95 is probably the most ridiculous price ever. If they are going to charge a ridiculous price for pho, at least make it good. Their pho is so horrible. The broth tasted old and it tasted like they pour chicken broth into their pho or something.. I also tried a little of my wife's dry noodles and I can't believe they call themselves a chef here. The noodles has no taste, the chicken was dry, the fish tasted old, and there was no sauce to the dry noodles...   Seriously that will be my last time there. 9.95 for a bowl of pho that's not even pho and the horrible service... no thank you....

This was my first visit and first time every eating pho.  Restaurant was very clean. Staff was super nice and attentive without hovering wanting us to leave. The owner was so nice to chat with about his business. Will return.

My girlfiends have been saying they've been wanting to try pho forever! They finally decided to meet and up at unPhogettable so they could try pho and catch up on some needed girl time.   The ones who've never had pho of course ordered it and were very impressed with their dishes. Now, I've had pho before and I enjoy eatting it but my favorite dish off any Vietnamese menu is the bun, which is what I call a "yummy meat and noodle salad." unPhogettable delivered on the "yummy!" I also ordered the shrimp summer rolls with their peanut sauce!  My favorite!  I hope to return to unPhogettable and try the pho when I'm in more of a soup mood! Yum!
I really like this place! I tried their beef pho and it was amazing! I will recommend this place to anybody, try it!

I love the name, but was the pho really unphogettable?  No.  Sorry.  Located in Mekong Plaza inside the supermarket, which can be crazy during the weekend, this is really a great location for a pho restaurant.  There are several LCDs for your viewing pleasure.  I really loved the painted bamboo murals on the walls and the contrasting taupe wall with some dark red in other areas.  The decor here is nice compared to other Vietnamese restaurants I've been to.  Very modern-esque.  Another plus, is the recess lighting over the tables which adds a better ambiance to the restaurant.  I am a fan of modernized restaurants especially Asian ones because back home, I'm accustomed to white walls and non-fancy decor.   But even with awesome decor and ambiance, the food was just ok.  I've had better and I think it's just gimmicky.    Food here is a bit pricier, but I guess that's what you're paying for.
I love this place. The food is always top notch and the servings are large. Worth every penny. Friendly , helpful staff. I will continue frequenting this awesome restaurant.
Great food, great service, fair prices. As an Asian who lives in Arizona where it is hard to find authentic, quality Asian food, I highly recommend this place.

This was always my to go place for pho. Especially when your hungover! The pho dac biet was always good and never disappointing. The broth was just right and you get a good amount of noodles and meat. But my favorite entrees would be bun bo hue or bun rieu. I can never get enough of having good spicy food. Although it wasn't as spicy as I wanted it to be. So I always ask for a side of chilli paste and extra peppers. The service was great and drinks were refill very quickly even when they are busy. If I'm ever back in Az  for whatever reasons again and I'm in need of pho I'll definitely be hitting this place up!

Still keeping the rating the same, however I did try a rice plate here just out of curiosity and I wish I had the noodle soup instead. The portions were much smaller than I expected and the dish didn't include any fish sauce like most places, though I'm not sure if that's the norm here or not. Either way I will be back for the Pho.

I love, love, love coming to this place! It gives me the feeling of family and that's a great addition for any restaurant to have!  The soups have been great and they will work with you on your choices.  I don't know if anyone is aware of that, but it took some time and chatting with the sweet owner to discover this.  I love getting the soups with the soft tofu and minus any carrots and every time, its perfect.  The desserts are also awesome.  I love getting the red bean.  Its the right amount of beans with the sweet coconut milk...and makes me "think" that maybe this could be healthy.    I say, if you haven't tried out this wonderful place then do so and do it quickly and then sit back and enjoy!

* sigh of relief *   THERE IS AUTHENTIC ASIAN FOOD IN THE VALLEY!  great service, good pho. the broth wasn't oily nor watered down. average pricing for a bowl of pho (8.25 for the special).  also ordered hieu tieu nam vang, my favorite soup dish. however it wasn't so great here; broth was bland, large serving.  salad rolls and peanut sauce are just like any other place, nothing special nor bad.   I LOOOOOOOOVED that they had disposable chopsticks and sauce dishes. very clean and inviting setting.

My husband loves pho, and since I had never tried it, we decided to give this place a try based on the reviews seen here on yelp. The restaurant was clean, and the service was great with highly attentive staff. We tried  the meatball and rare steak pho and were very impressed! The flavors were delicious and the meats were prepared wonderfully. We will definitely be back.

unPhogettable was a great restaurant! I was particularly happy to see that they have three vegetarian dishes under a separate vegetarian menu heading. They can also make vegetarian pho with vegetable stock. They have vegetarian spring rolls and crispy spring rolls. I ordered the vegetarian flat noodles, my mother ordered the vegetarian pho, and my husband ordered the vermicelli noodles with shrimp. We got an order of vegetarian spring rolls to share. Everything was excellent! The owners were super friendly and the service was fast and courteous. I love the fact that they have various sauces and utensils at the table so that you can experiment with flavors without having to keep asking the waiter to bring you over some more sauce. We will definitely be back!

Not the best Pho you can get, I'm Vietnamese so I had a lot of experience with Pho, this one not so much unless you're American only had Pho for a few times, in my opinion the broth is bland and this place is OVERPRICED for Pho. Yes that's right white folks y'all just got ripped off. I like the Bun Mam here the flavor is really good but for $10 the portion was way too small for the price. Giving this place a 3 stars for me is being generous.

Wonderful establishment. Great food, great authentic Vietnamese soft-drinks and deserts. And most of all, incredibly friendly, outgoing staff. In contrast to almost every other genuinely ethnic Asian restaurant, these people understand that a lot of white people are a little uncertain or inexperienced when it comes to Asian food. They guide you through the menu, answer all of your questions, and are very attentive and friendly. Wow, what a contrast to most Asian places I've been to! And because of this great service they have a huge non-Asian following. What a smart business model! The food is excellent: the rice noodle bowls, Pho (Vientamese beef or chicken soups), and fried rice dishes. They have great appetizers and one of the absolute best soft drinks which is an authentic beverage made of soda water, lime juice, ice and simple syrup. In just the right proportions, this drink is heaven. The bottom line, if you're one of those people who is curious about trying Vietnamese food, but feel a little awkward or intimidated, this is the place for you! In contrast, if you're an old hand who's powered through hundreds of noodle bowls, can pronounce all the dishes in their mother tongue, and are deft enough to catch flies with chop-sticks, this is still the place for you!!!

Met up with a group of friends to celebrate a birthday, and was surprised to find out this place was here! Delicious pho soup, excellent service!  After dinner, we walked around and shopped at the Asian market attached to this little restaurant. All of the tea is here, people. Come get whatever is your favorite.  I've stopped here on the way home from work for dinner to go, several times since. Unphogettable. See what they did there?
Been here a few times and it's literally my go-to place when I'm craving pho. The service is fast and the food is amazing.

A little more "American" than the Vietnamese places we usually go to but the food was very good and the staff was very friendly and attentive. The place is pretty and very clean. It's pricier than most Vietnamese restaurants and they have fewer options but would probably go there again.

Best pho in PHX hands down. #13 is my all time fave. the fresh rolls with shrimp and pork are also divine. they seat you quickly, serve your food within a few minutes of ordering, and send you on your way happy as can be.  unPhogettable.. that's what you areee.

My wife was feeling a bit queasy after shopping at the nearby grocery store.  So stopped in just for her to rest, but the manager seemed to notice she was feeling and uneasy and offered to make her something that will make her feel better.    He made her some sort of noodle dish that she loved.  I had the tendon pho and it was great.  We have liked this unPhogettable ever since.

My dinner partner has been mentioning this restaurant for several months. I think he was most taken by the catchy name. I was not particularly anxious to drive clear across the valley for dinner when I have three stalwart Vietnamese restaurants close by. But because I am a food adventurer I acquiesced to his repeated suggestion.  This diner (I will not describe it as a restaurant) is in a shopping center serving, what might be described as the Asian market, adjacent to an Asian/international supermarket.  It was clean and had a number of patrons. We were immediately greeted and seated. Our service throughout the evening was courteous and gracious.  I requested from our server than my order be the house specialty pho', which she identified as #1. I made a point of telling her that I consider the 'side vegetables' an important part of my meal and that I use/eat ALL my side produce (people who eat pho' know what I'm talking about).  When my dinner was served I had to stop myself from exclaiming out loud. The first thing out of my mouth was to tell my dinner companion that was the last meal I would have at 'Un pho gettable.'  The pho' is nearly twice the cost of all three locations in CenPho (central Phx). The dish of produce additives was so conservative that I still huff to think about it. And, the flavor (lack thereof) of the broth/meat was disappointing.  Service and cleanliness is very important, hence the three stars.

My boyfriend and I are addicted to this place! We come here up to three times a week and I find myself craving it on the days we can't make it here!! The chicken broth is the best I've ever had and the service is always wonderful, they have super motivated and attentive staff which I appreciate!
my favorite place when I lived in Arizona and loved coming back to get my pho fix. portions are generous and the broth is very rich and flavorful!

The spicer the better. Make sure to get the S1! I usually go for the P1 with the soft tendon, meatballs, tripe, lean brisket, and fatty brisket. Of all of the Pho restaurants that I have been to in Phoenix, I would say that this one is close to the top. Really accessable and easy to find and attached to a great international market. It has a laid back style to it and the waitstaff is very friendly.    A quick tip for any bowl of Pho that you get, order extra noodles on the side instead of another bowl if you are still hungry. It is a lot less expensive and gives you more to eat.

My favorite Pho place. The brisket is always tender and delicious and the service it fast. Seriously, sometimes it is like a Jimmy Johns commercial, we order our food and they bring it out a minute later. If you are new to pho or you aren't sure what you should put in your pho, just go with the brisket, you will love it. The only problem is the plaza that they are in can get busy and there will be no parking and 30 cars circling the parking lot. No restaurant is good enough to put up with that. It seems like half the time we go there we end up going somewhere else because there it no parking.

Surprisingly good. I dont like pho in general. I know, im a weirdo. I normally eat pho at home because in general i find pho broth at restaurants to be a bit too oily for my taste. Anyways this place is pretty good. $10 for a bowl is much too expensive for me though. Lived in the bay area and the size here would be considered a medium for $7 at most.

I LOVE LOVE LOVE this place. I crave it all the time and it's hands down the best in the area. I drive 20 minutes just to eat the chicken pho! Veggies are always fresh and the soup is always amazing. I use so much hot chili paste that my broth turns red. I could eat this pho every  single day. YUM

I absolutely loved eating at unPHÕgettable! This was one of my first experiences eating phõ, and I think the overall experience was great for a first- timer. The menu was very easy to read, and there is a variety of main ingredient dishes to chose from (chicken, beef, pork and vegetarian options like tofu). Minus one star because the service was ehh- the waitresses weren't exactly "warm" if you know what I mean. Overall, the food was ridiculously good. I would recommend this place to anyone eating to try phõ for the first time or to an experienced phõ eater.

Cool place by the market but let us be honest. The food is not good. The price is ridiculously expensive. I've been here couple times and I think i had enough experience with this place.  $12 for a simple bowl of super dry/chewy noodles with dry/tough microwaved(they called it grilled) pork. This is not an authentic Vietnamese restaurant at all. Or it is if you would consider it, but the taste of the food is so bad that make me think it is not. Two people come in and easily spend like above $30. Are you kidding me? With that money i think we can have much more better food with better service elsewhere. Just not worth it.

The owner is what makes this place POPPING! Down to earth people and no bs. I'm from California and I'm very meticulant on the type of pho I go to. This is by far THEE BEAT OR EVEN BETTER THEN CALIFORNIA! Try this out .   The only negatives is probably that it gets busy at night...they probably need to make it bigger!!
Thanks for the good reviews.  It helped me decide between several different Vietnamese restaurants in Chandler.   Great food.  Great Pho.  Clean.  Everything was well presented.

pros... 1.  the veg are fresh 2.  the restaurant is clean.  love it.  must give the owner a 5 stars on cleanliness of the place, even the sauces on the table (covers were not covered w/spilled sauces). 3.  convenient  cons... 1.  expensive 2.  service is very slow (you will be frustrated if you are hungry).  we went there 4 times and it average about 20 minutes for the 1st order to come and there was a time the 2nd bowl of noodles takes another 20 minutes. 3.  the beef in the beef noodles are lean meat.  I prefer fatty beef when I eat Vietnamese noodles just like how they do it in Chicago or LA.

After taking a break from going here a long while ago due to a very bad service, here I am again and I am so excited about how big of a change of unPhogettable. The restaurant is crowded when I walk in, but I get greeted right away with a very prudent manner by a friendly server.   I have dined in at numerous places and I still favor the ones that make me feel warm, welcomed, that my business is greatly appreciate and you, unPhogettable, you have done that for me, so I thank you!  About the food, I order Pho as always to determine if there is any adjustments in the quality, and I have to say the smell and the flavorful favor say it all! I really dig the Pho, but comparing to other places, the Pho in this place is not my favorite. However, I will definitely come back here and there to try out other items on the menu as well.

Oh, I hesitated before we entered this what seems to be a pretty highly rated yelp restaurant...  The only reason for 2 stars instead of a one  is a super friendly service. Our waiters were excellent, very helpful and accommodating. It is absolutely not their fault that food is mediocre. Actually, what was strange is that they charged our CC just the amount on the bill and did not include the tip my husband left. Bill was $26.40, my husband signed for $31, but online I see a charge of $26.40 only.  I don't know if I should call and make sure that waiters got their tip... I guess, I will do it on Monday.  We ordered pho chin ( well done brisket ). The broth was good, but nothing spectacular, brisket itself was still pretty chewy and tasteless. I expected it to be at least a little bit better, but if you are hungry and want something hot, go for it. The portion is very generous.  Vegetable Cha Gio (Fried Vietnamese egg rolls) was completely soaked in some oil, which totally ruined the dish. It looked like their fryer was not hot enough when they dipped rolls for cooking. Another possibility is that oil was old. Neither of the scenarios excites me.  Vermicelli with seasoned grilled shrimps disappointed as well. There were only 5 tiny shrimps on the top, pretty rubbery but tasty. The rest seemed to be 2 pounds of vermicelli.  I don't know what everyone else with 5 star reviews ate there, but whatever we had was not that. I don't mind cheap, ethnic food, and I know that it can be inexpensive but still very good.   I will not repeat, but I encourage you to try. Maybe, it was a bad day and you will get something better. Again, the service is very friendly, I kind of feel bad leaving such a negative review, but I cannot lie and led other people believe that the food was good.
The Pho was not the best and it's expensive. I paid $33 for two bowls of pho and some egg rolls.

This is the best pho I have had since moving from California to Arizona. Although I've had some awkward situations with the customer service there, I have never had a bad meal. They have all your typical pho soups for about $9/bowl, but they also have more unusual types from different parts of Vietnam which I appreciate and have not been brave enough to try. I like to stick to my brisket and tendon pho and fresh spring rolls... but I'll be a bit more adventurous soon :)

I've been going to unphogettable for about 5 years and in those 5 years their pho taste the same . It's consistent and taste great to me ! I always get a bowl of soup and a side of spring rolls . Delicious!! I was also very happy to find out that they have a kids menu. When I first started coming here I didn't have any kids but now I do and it makes it a lot easier than sharing my pho or ordering another and not being able to finish it . The only reason why I'm not giving 5 stars is because sometimes they don't really have great customer service skills . They don't say much to you and point at where you need to sit .  I always recommend this restaurant to people and I probably always will .

This place deserves its name. The pho was as good as any I had elsewhere and the springrolls, both fried and raw, were delightful. The employees seemed overworked and nonchalant, however. I almost gave this place 5 stars.

Amazing, I've been there several times. I usually get the #9 Pho w/ brisket & tenderloin and the egg rolls.  The broth is slow cooked daily. The herbs are fresh and the pho is delicious.  The staff is very friendly and attentive.  I live several miles away but it's worth the trip even though there are several pho restaurants along the way.  Plus there is a great bakery and market nearby to walk around after dinner. They also have delicious tea (hot or iced) which is a nice break from the usual soda pop.

unPHOgettable is quite PHOnomenal For being Asian, service is remarkable Get filled up for less than ga$ in your abdominal No MSG, no trans-fat makes it responsible  Summer rolls and pork taste so verrry nice  Add some Sriracha and chili for that extra spice Oh! Love me long time, I need more rice! If ya don't have yellow fever, you'll be enticed  Even my round-eye BF began to slant Clapping his hands in a chant Tried ordering more, though his pants can't Calm down cracker, no need to take a chance On a food coma, me want some late night romance  Being Vietnamese, I'm keeping it PHO-real Eat here for an authentic PHO-bulous meal Situated next to an Asian market  For that trustworthy PHO-king feel  PHO-shizzle, PHO-sho, this ain't no faux-Pho
Had the Pho Tai there.  Service wasn't bad, but the food was overpriced and medicore.  You're better off going somewhere else nearby like Khai Hoan or Pho Thanh.

Sorry but why do people like this place ? They have great reviews but the people who like this are people who don't know what good pho is . Growing up Vietnamese and eating pho this place just isn't good . The soup isn't flavorful which means I have to had extra hoisin and sirracha to it . The price is a little bit expensive compared to other pho places who have the best pho ever and give bigger portions . Like common people get out more and try other places!!!!
This is a very clean joint with good service.  The portions aren't huge but the owners care about how their food is prepared and presented.  I totally recommend this place.

Even in this heat I'd eat Pho. The tofu veggie spring rolls (not fried) were delicious and so was the peanut sauce they came with. Had the beef base Pho with brisket and steak. The meat was pretty good quality and the beef broth was good. I would come back here when coming back to the Mesa/Tempe area.
Soo good, cheap, and good for kids. I got my two little boys grilled chicken and beef with a side of white rice.
Excellent Pho. One of the best I've had. The broth is very flavorful. I had the steak pho and shrimp spring rolls. Both were great. Passes the come again test.
Super bomb! From the egg rolls to the fried rice with shrimp/pork to the beef pho! Everything was soooo delicious and fresh! Id definitely come here again!

Favorite place to eat at when i go to the Asian market. I know theres others places but i love eating here. My bf and i usually share our pho because the portion of pho are so huge. We usually get the rare beef, I've had the chicken before but for new guest get the rare beef it taste better and has less ginger. The price is a little experience for pho but like i said the portions are big.
Long time returning customer! This is a great place to eat and the people are extremely nice
It was worth the drive. This place was clean and the service was excellent. Ordered Bun Rieu and it was one of the best.

Okay, I know that anyone checking my profile is going to see a bunch of 5-star reviews...I'm just starting with the places I LOVE (I'll get around to places I don't...later...if I feel like revisiting poor experiences).  UnPhogettable definitely fits this description, hands-down my favorite pho place EVER.  The menu is big, a really nice selection, but I have to admit that, despite visiting every couple weeks, I continue to order the same thing...the sliced pork bun with egg rolls is just TOO GOOD to pass up.  It's a wonderful cross between a hot rice noodle dish and a salad: fresh, refreshing, satisfying and flavorful.  The quality is typical of the rest of the menu...this place is consistent and reliable.  The portions are perfect...for two meals!  (I've discovered that most reheat well for lunch the next day).  I have almost finished the bun once, an accomplishment I am truly proud of.  The atmosphere is really friendly...hip and modern-trendy, with informal seating at long tables, very relaxed.  The restaurant is very clean, and is a part of the Mekong Plaza shopping complex...so you've got an awesome Asian market to roam through after lunch.  The staff are very attentive, and the owners are FANTASTIC - super-friendly, great sense of humor, and even remember my favorite order (which is pretty good with the number of customers they get!).  I never can believe the check when it comes, either...incredible amount of food for the price.  If you like pho and bun, this place will compare favorably with anything you've had anywhere else.  IF YOU'VE NEVER HAD IT, are you in for a treat!  Give this a shot, you will not be disappointed!
Great place to eat. Love the pho. Again just wished these asian restaurants would be more attentive with their customers drinks haha

The terrible experience here was really unPhogettable. They should be honored that I'm not allowed to give them zero stars. The table wasn't sanitized properly seeing as there are brown, sticky spots that I accidentally put my arm upon. The poor costumer service wasn't really something that bother because I rather prioritize the quality of the food instead. I ordered the typical pho. The broth was flavorful, sadly that's the only good thing about it. The meat was a disappointment, rubbery, and old. Almost like it has been sitting in the freezer for 5 years before being finally served to unfortunate customers. The texture of the noodles felt like plastic. It's sad that this place receives such praising reviews yet I didn't get to experience myself.

I've been to this pho spot a fee times for lunch and it never disappoints. It's usually busy, but the service is fast efficient and friendly. There are lots of community tables to sit at when you walk in. This makes for a kinda noisy restaurant but I certainly don't mind it at all. There are some smaller tables available as well. From the outside it's a strip mall but the decor inside is quite nice and not what you would expect!  The menu has a good selection of a variety of Pho, egg noodle and regional soups, vermicelli salads, entrees and appetizers. I've had the summer and autumn rolls with peanut sauce and they are fresh, crisp and delish every time. They are filled just right, not too much yet not to skimpy. The veggies and meats taste like they had just been put together, which is just as it should be. While I don't like too much peanut sauce, I do like it here as it's not too sticky and sweet. I've also tried the pho and it is great! While they are very flexible and offer a variety of ingredients for the pho it is the broth that really stands out. It's savory and well balanced, you can taste the beef and spices and it's wonderful. I love love the lingering star anise taste in every spoonful.  Know that you can pick up take out here and they package it very very well!

I went during lunch time and it wasn't super busy yet. The parking situation for this side of the plaza is horrible since its near phoenix palace which caters to huge parties and family functions so expect to park a little far if you don't want to dance around other cars getting in and out. I got a dac biet and the broth itself was a little sweet for my taste but the rest of the bowl was pretty solid as far as the meat goes. I gave them an extra star since everyone gets an individual veggie plate! We all know how weird it is to ration veggies when you go to a pho place.

Another good stop in Mekong Plaza.  Friendly and efficient service.  The servers always take the time to explain each dish, and are genuinely concerned that you get exactly what you want.  Very fresh ingredients make for great pho, and you will find it here.

I enjoy my meal every time I'm here. I ordered the vegetable fried spring rolls and the #21 Pho which has chicken based broth and seafood. It was delicious. It took a while for my spring rolls to come out, so I rushed to eat them so I could enjoy my Pho while it was steaming hot!

I had the #1.  It was pretty tasty.  The broth could have used more flavor.  Overall it was good.  3 stars because it was $8.50 for a normal size bowl which was still a bit small compared to others.  Where I'm from its $5-6 for a regular and $6-7 for a large bowl.  I paid $10 after tax and tip.  That is ridicules for a bowl of pho.  Apparently the owner said they use all natural ingredients.  I really don't care and I probably won't go back unless if they drop their prices.

This place is part of an Asian mini-mall.  It's awesome.   This was a very clean, modern-looking place.  It wasn't very crowded on a Wednesday afternoon.  Parking was easy.  The staff greeted me as soon as I walked in.  I had a seat and got to ordering...a #9 (rare steak and brisket pho).  It was about $7.50.   I received my food about five minutes later.  Loved it.  Packed with flavor, unlike some of the previous reviews have mentioned.  The woman came over and told me to mix some of the hoisin sauce with some of the hot sauce and lime juice.  I tried her suggestion and dipped the meat into it - man, how awesome this stuff was...  She also mentioned they do not use MSG.    I'd hit this place up again in a heartbeat for some of the best pho ever!

One of the Best if not THE BEST places in the Valley to have Pho.  #15 Chicken Pho is my favorite.  I don't go out to eat for lunch with my co-workers often, but when I do, I always vote for coming here.  The staff is friendly and the service is great.  The food is the icing on the cake and it's superb!  I highly recommend this place, it's Yummy!

I rarely give places one star, but I guess there truly is a first for everything. I was out in Arizona for the first time, craving Vietnamese food and my friend took me here! The name really hooked me in, it's so catchy and punny- I am all about the puns.   But I was truly disappointed throughout my meal. Staff overall were not very friendly or unattentive, despite the fact that the restaurant was not busy at all. My friends all ordered the Pho - which they said was adequate. I was feeling different and decided to order my favorite, banh canh cua. Now this dish is not very hard to mess up, but when the bowl came out - it was ALL broth. A huge bowl of broth, with sunken mini pile of noodles, one small piece of pork and two shrimp. This was IT! For the description on the menu, something along the lines of seafood soup with vietnamese udon....this was hardly fitting.   I figured, okay maybe the portions are just small. I took my first sip of the broth, and already my experience continued to get worse. The broth was practically hot WATER. Pretty tasteless, no flavor besides the fact that it was red color, I wonder where they got that from since it did not taste like anything. There were kinda floating tiny pieces of crab throughout the broth but they were so small, you barely had any. I'm midway through my soup, forcing myself to eat it since I was starving...and then I found a PIECE OF PLASTIC in the soup. Clear plastic, a piece as big as my finger....wonder how they were able to miss that putting in my bowl but also shame on me for eating half my bowl and not realizing it. Maybe because all they gave me was broth, and it was just lost in this soup.   I ordered some summer rolls to go in case I got hungry, since I did not have much for lunch. And those were even more disappointing than the soup if you can imagine that. Peanut sauce tasted like they just stirred some peanut butter together and put it in a cup. The roll was hard, and chewy beyond measure. It was tough, and the noodles wrapped inside were definitely not cooked all the way. Meat inside the roll was tough. The whole roll was tough - TOUGH TO EAT!!   Did not enjoy this place, and to say the least - this restaurant was definitely unPHOgettable for me -________-

This is the best place in town to get good Pho'. The broth is very flavorful and full of noodles and all the goodies you can pile on.  The special fried rice is delish with little tiny squares of ham in there you pick up with your chopsticks.  Taste like candy!!  Prices are fair for a gigantic bowl of soup that tastes good and is very healthy.  I always take my leftovers home for lunch the next day!  When you are done eating here stroll through the Mekong Market for a tour of Vietnam!  Then go to Aoozy bakery right next door and get a bag or nine of the almond crisps!  They are quite delightful!  I love this place!

The best pho ga ive had. they cook their broth something insane like 24 hours and you can tell. the service is super friendly and you can tell the family owned store has a passion for vietnamese cuisine. the bakery beside is a good place for dessert after, too.

Pretty good pho for the Mesa area, the pho I think had a hint of MSG, but overall well cooked noodles, good beef slices, fast and nice service, clean, and good portions. Prices are more than I expected for the Mesa area, but not unreasonable.

Their pho is the worst I had in the az area.  with respect to the other rave review, their only saving grace is good service, esp for people who had not had vietnamese food before, as their servers do speak better english and because they are not crowded usually, they would have more time and patience to explain the food to you.    The reason why they are not crowded is because they are located in a vietnamese/asian centric mall with large crowds of asians shopping for food and groceries at the mekong supermarket, and they know a good pho from a bad one.  Trust me I am asian :)     Going here would be like a vegetarian going to texas roadhouse and having them cook up a steak and try to explain to you the fine art of grilling aged beef.    If you are at the Mekong plaza area, and U need some vietnamese food, go to the other vietnamese restaurant that is directly across from them, I can't recall the name, but they have a large menu full of rice dishes and stuff.  U can order like noodle items too, I love their dry house special noodles there.    If you are new to vietnamese food and would like an intro, I guess this place might work, so 1 star for that.  there are a lot of other places U can go to like Khai Hoang, Dat Vang or even Saigon.

I am a Pho enthusiast, and I must say that this is one of the best Pho I have ever tried.  The prices are comparable to similar restaurants but the quality, service and cleanliness are outstanding.  Every single time that my family and I have been to this restaurant, the owner and sometimes his lovely wife is there to greet us.   I visit this restaurant at least once a month, and every time has been an enjoyable experience.
Great food, great service, CLEAN, very enjoyable! Right in same plaza as great shopping too, a bonus!

I used to love this place. We came here weekly. Now a days not so much, you see the last couple times I've shown up 45 minutes before closing (1st time) then an hour and fifteen minutes (2nd time) they've told me they were closed. Kind of bullshit to have a different time listed on your door if you ask me! Anyways, decent for pho. That's all I recommend there though.

First time I ever tried pho in my life. I came here with a group of four friends and had a good time. The servers were really nice and frequently checked on us at our table. They were also happy to teach us what the name of the dishes were. I definitely will stop by again in the near future.
I keep coming back because their food is great and they are possibly the nicest restaurant owners I have ever met.  I wish it were closer to our house, but its worth the drive.
My husband and I love this place. Vegan menu options are awesome, food is fantastic and staff is always welcoming and friendly. We literally eat here 2 or 3 times a month.

I'm from Central California and this Phò place is not bad compares to the ones I been to. They are still flavorful and delicious. However they do need a few more side ingredient and it will be amazingly awesome! But I definitely recommend this place to eat delicious phò!

Hands down...the best Pho in the valley. My GF and I ate here today for the first time and loved it. The owners came out to greet us and welcome us to their establishment for the first time. She explained how the beef broth is simmered for 24 hours and the chicken broth simmers for 12. What a great selling point. The Pho was great. It was fresh and the broth was amazing. Crisp clean taste with crisp clean flavors. The portions are large and we have plenty to take home. We will definitely be back.

I wish I could give this place 6 stars.   We purchased the Groupon and went on the same night to unPhogettable.  By 6PM, this place was boomin.    We ordered the soft summer rolls (pork sausage), #8 (Pho with brisket and flank) and the #48 (steamed rice with seasoned grilled sliced beef).   The summer rolls were very good and came with a delish house sauce.  We hadn't received our dinners yet when a server came over and asked if we had the Groupon.  We said yes, and she explained that they couldn't accept it until the next day.  We hadn't read that on the deal, so I was a little frustrated (not mad, but just like, 'dangit!').  The owner stopped by and we talked to him for a few minutes.  We looked at our Groupon and saw that it DID say it couldn't be used until the next day.  So it was totally our over-sight.    He explained that a few tables had gotten mad and walked out, and they only did the Groupon to get new people to try their restaurant since June is the quietest month for most restaurants in the valley.  We told him that we didn't care about the Groupon, and were there for the food not the deal.  We decided we would just use the Groupon the next weekend.   Needless to say, he was very excited and grateful. I think we were more excited about our dinners though.    When our meals came out, he showed us the Vietnamese way to eat Pho and the rice and meat plate.  That was really cool.  It was obvious that he took great pride in his restaurant and food, and wanted to make sure everyone was happy.   I can't explain how amazing the food was. The #48 came with a broth on the side that you eat first to cleanse your palate.  I could have just eaten that as my meal and been totally satisfied.  The sauce on the beef was hard to explain.  It was slightly sweet, but had a lot of depth.  I was reluctant to share.   The Pho broth was fantastic.  After all of the noodles, meat and bean sprouts were gone, and we were both stuffed, I couldn't stop sipping the broth.  Seriously. It was so good, I didn't mind over-stuffing myself.   We said we would be back next weekend.  I don't think I can wait that long.

They have vegetarain pho! So many vegetables, tofu, and broth. It warms my soul :). I will come back again for it! There are other vegetarian items if you are not interested in pho.    Here are some vegetarian items: - Sautee seasonal vegetable with rice - Vegetarian fried rice - Wide noodle wok fried with vegatables - Vegetarian noodle soup - Vegetarian eggroll salad

I had the pho with brisket and rare steak and it was good. Very flavorful and good size of a bowl. My wife had vermicelli with pork and that was really, really delicious. It was good overall, but next time I'm at Mekong Plaza, I'll probably give it a shot to the other restaurants just to compare.

Love this place! I am a huge fan of the # 9 but my new fav is #24. This place is very clean and always full of customers. They keep the A/C on and it's nice and cool just like it should be in the summertime. The employees here are awesome too. Always very nice and seem to remember everyone! That's the kind of restaurant I love!!
Fabulous pho!   The owner Chan was very nice and informative (I brought a first timer!). And dorothy n other servers were so nice and helpful!  cant wait to go back!!
I had lunch here today with co workers and it was absolutely delicious! Cannot wait to go back gain.

Pho is good here as it should be, hence the name. The broth had really good flavor and wasn't overly salty nor oily. The veggies that accompanied it was fresh and crisp. This place is extremely clean. I really like the disposable chopsticks and sauce cups at each table. Rice plates are okay - I prefer the place across for rice plates.   Very good service. The owner was charming and pleasant. Price was a couple bucks more than the average pho joint but nothing outrageous.

Best Pho around! Not greasy like a lot of places. Spring rolls are awesome and so are entrees. My family and I have been coming here since the Mekong plaza opened. The owner is sooooo nice. The staff is always friendly as well. The restaurant is clean and prices are reasonable. Definitely recommend!

Great day pho soup!  I've been wanting to try this place inside Mekong Plaza.  I ordered the Seafood Chicken based Rice Noodle Pho with a side order of egg roll that my son and I shared.  The soup had a couple of small shrimp, a couple small pieces of squid and two split tiny shrimp balls.  Although, the broth was very tastey, I didn't think it was worth $8.50.  Nothing special about the eggroll.    Hubby ordered the curry based beef soup.  It was more or less stewed beef peppered with pho spices.  A little lackluster for my taste.  The price is a little more than what I wanted to pay for a so-so pho.  There are 3 or 4 choices of soup on the KID'S MENU.  The service was excellent!  We'll go back to try other entrees on their menu.

Very good pho.  We also tried the bun which is like pho without the broth?  (That's the best i can describe it.)  We always get spring rolls with our meals and it is refreshing.    The service is great!  I always judge how well they are doing by my drink. If it never gets half full they are great.  It's not often servers are on it like here.  Definitely a 5 star for service.    I highly recommend it.

I really like the food here and service is usually pretty good. The last time, our waitresses were non vietnamese who had ridiculously long acrylic nails on, it personally grossed me out a bit as it appears a bit unprofessionsl but they don't touch the food so I guess it doesn't matter. It is just weird to see non asian people working in an asian restaurant. The spring rolls are pretty average but sauce is different with a coconut flavor.
Had a great time here! The staff was great, service was good (even in a holiday rush), and the food was top notch! Couldn't have asked for a better lunch :)

Always a great time here.  Today I opted for the wonton soup.  I think it's the best in the valley with fresh wontons, a great broth, and little pieces of shrimp and fish cake in there.  The BBQ pork also adds to the flavor.  This place never dissapoints.

Another decent Pho place in the greater Phoenix area. This one is very clean and nicely decorated.  Staff is very friendly.  Pho and spring rolls are delicious. Price is a little more expensive compared to other pho places. But you do get a lot of food here.
My family came here and ate when they visited me once--the food is good, although nothing extraordinary. It was slightly more expensive than what I am used to.

If you're looking for some great Pho, this is definitely a place to check out.  It's located right dab in a Vietnamese shopping center, how can you really go wrong?    I ordered the Viet iced tea with cream which was a lot less sweet than the Thai teas I'm used to, it was surprising but still very delicious.  The appetizer ordered was the Summer Rolls which house a large hunk of spicy sausage in it, the sauce to dip it in was really sweet and didn't cling to the roll well, I think I'd rather have had hoisin sauce with it.  I ordered the white meat combo noodle soup bowl.  This consisted of a couple of pieces of imitation crab, fish cake balls, shrimp, pork slices and calamari.  Each was quite good in its own right except the imitation crap which had started to flake and come apart in the hot broth.  The broth by the way was fabulous, didn't overpower the meats but added enough flavor to them, much like a fondue broth, while still more than delicious enough to slurp the rest of the way through once all the solid bits were gone.  The reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is even after showing we've been around the block with Vietnamese food we were constantly being given instructions on what was good and what newcomers to Vietnamese cuisine should try.  I mean once is good service, but after the customer replies that they've had it before don't continue to treat them like newbie white devils...some of us are a little more travelled than others, thanks.

One of the better place for Vietnamese cuisine. The spring rolls are made fresh with each order and the sauce is nutty to the taste. Try the Pho, taste as it was like in Vietnam. Authentic Vietnamese dishes.   This restaurant is next to the main entrance of a Asian strip mall. Parking is free but expect large crowds exotically on a weekend. Place is clean and come early, as there might be a long line waiting for tables.   There is an Asian market too, for those who like to get groceries after a meal.

Not bad, but not amazing. I came here with my husband and were seated right away. They had a large menu, but only one vegetarian option. It was $10 or $11 and only had a very small amount of tofu. The taste was good and I was full, but we ended up only getting two bowls of soup, one drink and it was $35. Very pricey and not great.

We read about this place on yelp and we're excited to go try it. But we won't be going back. We were sat quickly but asked if we would share a table. Which wasn't a huge deal. We were asked by two different servers if we were ready to order. We ordered with the second server. 35 min later we had to ask about our food. 5 min later we were notified that our order had been "lost" . I explained to the server that we were not going to wait. She looked confused about why we wanted to leave. Bummer that we didn't get to eat!
Delicious pho, spring rolls, and peanut dipping sauce.

I can not say enouph good things about this place. The first time we walked in, the owner greeted us like we had stepped into his living room. I am pho phonatic, so I knew what to order, but my friends were still getting used to the pronunicaiton. The owner dove into the menu, explaining that he liked to educate his customers so we knew exactly what we were getting. That personal touch won me over immediately.  Then the pho came out. I don't exaggerate when I say it was the best I've had in a while. It might have been because of the fresh ingredients the owner told us about, or the good ratio of broth-to-meat-to-veggies, but either way it was delicious. The egg rolls were also tasty, but I just wish we were served more (that's more of a comment on my appetite).  I've been back several times, and unPhogettable does not dissapoint. Also, check out the massive Asian grocery store attached. If you want alcohol, you're allowed to buy some there and bring it in. Bonus points!

Good pho if you like your soup base light and fragrant. If you're looking for something brothier and sweeter, look elsewhere. Also i've noticed that their noodles seem fresher than at other places. Might be because they're right next to an Asian grocery store...

Before unPhoegettable I had never tasted vietnamese food, after trying pho for the first time I automatically fell in love with it and added to my faves. I've tried other restaurants that serve pho, from holes in the wall to fancy places and nothing still nothing compares to this place. The crispy pork rolls are out of this world. Service can be better thats why I gave it four stars. To make this review simple...this place is unpho-king-believable.

If you frequent Mekong plaza, then you have probably seen unPhogettable on your way in. unPhogettable is a great place for Pho. I am a big fan of noodle soups and I loved the vegetarian Pho. The service was friendly and the overall experience was very nice.

Love this place! We always order the childrens pho thai and egg roles.  This is the perfect amount of food and the taste is amazing.   They use filtered water, your water glass in never empty, and the employees always give amazing service.   One of my favorites is the iced coffee as it is so refreshing.  If you want a great value, check them out and then go next door to the bakery for a treat.

Yep, this place is a winner.  I've been here twice, and left happy both times.  I love that they have vegetarian pho (with tofu and veggies instead of meat) and the service is incredible - you can tell they really love their business and their customers.  I will absolutely be stopping here whenever I'm in the area.  FYI, they don't serve beer/booze, but you can buy it in the market next door and bring it in!

My friend Steve turned me on to this place over a year ago, and Chan's unPhogettable is, for me, the final word on Pho in the valley.  The portions are incredible, the staff is so warm and friendly, and the Mekong Market is always a fun place to shop after an extremely satisfying meal.   Tip: TRY THE VIETNAMESE ICED COFFEE. There's a ritual to it, which is half the fun. The other half is DELICIOUS ICED COFFEE.

My favorite pho broth around!  Nice portions, good prices.  The staff treats you like family!  They are really just about the nicest people I've ever met at a restaurant.   I like their spring rolls, but I like the ones at Pho Ao Sen better (especially the peanut sauce there).  But this is my favorite place for pho.  It never lets me down and is always worth the drive.  The fifth star was given because I really feel like family when I'm there.

Welcoming and timely service.   Clean and well-run.  To someone who has spent many hours consuming pho in the hidden corners of Little Saigon in the OC - this was a very pleasant surprise.  Clientele was solid mix of gringos and asians.  Phood was 3.5 stars.  Disappointed in our $5.75 spring rolls - which were 'stuffed' mostly with rice noodles and razor thin slices of sausage.  But on the plus side the menu includes a whole page of interesting 'regional' noodle soups - so there are some off the beaten path options if you want to stray from the pho options.  Plenty of sprouts and leaves served alongside - most noodle soups in the $9-$10 range.  Prices about 15% above where they should be - but for such a pleasant and friendly environment it's worth the extra few bucks.  Note hot tea here is $1.95...  Would have assigned 3 stars purely on phood and prices - but great,friendly staff and service make this a 4 star review.

This place is unforgettable aright, I'm from Orange County an boi customer service is awesome  here. About the food well I order #2  pho bowl with magical stuff. Soup had alot of flavor meat was well cook. appetizer dish was little disappointed. Deep fried  egg rolls were little blaa, spring roll wasn't  spring at all super dry... won't stop me from coming here and trying other things
So many options and love the easy to read menu. Very simple place but great food! They even have simple options for kids which is a plus. Must try spring rolls!

I've been trying to look for a suitable substitute for pho here, since I eat it back home all the time. Compared to all the other places in the pheonix/glendale area I've been to, this is probably the best pho place and it's about 30 min from where I live.   It's not as good as the pho in the bay area, but it tastes close enough. The servers are really nice and the restaurant is clean which is a plus, since most pho places that taste really good are kind of dirty, and mom and pop-like, similar in Vietnam.   Since I'm vietnamese, it works in my favor ( I feel like I get more food and more quickly too). We came in a huge group and they reserved a table for us (unlike most vietnamese places which get you in and out as quickly as possible!) Most of us got pho, we shared spring rolls, and some others got bbq rice plates and bun bo hue (Spicy beef noodle). They even brought out the special onions to put in the pho (by request only). I think some got the special desserts and liked them as well. We all left really happy and most of us are from california so we know what good pho is ;)

PHO EVA!!!   This is my new spot, its clean and the customer service is a ten. There are tons of places to eat at the Mekong Plaza and I have tried a few but so far this little spot of paradise is THE best. Two thumbs up and a cheesy smile
Great pho soup and spring rolls. The food tastes fresh and everyone wins because you not get to eat fresh but you don't burn your wallet doing it. Jasmine tea is amazing as well!

I absolutely love this place! Truly some of the best pho I have had. I always want to try something else on the menu because it looks so good but I always end up with the pho because it's so darn good.  I highly recommend this place!
pretty good but a bit pricey but Im spoiled living here in Northern California!!

I went here with a group of 11 people yesterday for our monthly Vietnamese work lunch.  The short version of why I gave the low review was because the server was rude, and the food wasn't tasty. (Comparing to other pho places in the area, not homemade.) The positives are that the manager is nice; the decor is really nice as well, and the presentation of food is beautiful.  Long Version: Our group came into the restaurant at around 11:20 am yesterday. We were making our orders, and I ordered in English. Then, my co-workers told me I should order in Vietnamese to practice speaking. I awkwardly ordered in Vietnamese and asked for the pork bun and egg rolls with a bowl of pho broth. (In Vietnamese, there are two words for "bowl". A large bowl and a small bowl.) When I first ordered in English, I asked for a side bowl of broth. When I ordered in Vietnamese, I asked for a big bowl of broth. I cupped my hands in a small bowl gesture. While the server was standing there, my co-worker said in Vietnamese, "Make sure you say (small) bowl, not (big) bowl."   The food came out, and I saw this HUGE bowl of pho broth, and thought to myself, "Wow, these people are really generous with the side broth." I seriously got excited and snapchatted about it. And at this point, the manager comes by and asked us if everything is good, and we said we were good.  I eat the pork bun, and honestly it's not that bad, but the meat is pounded really thinly. Probably around ~1 and 1/2mm for each slice. The volume looks like a lot, but the mass of the actual meat is very little. You're looking at about 10% meat/egg roll, 40% noodles, and 50% vegetables. Also, it was really, really dry--similar to eating beef jerky with a little bit of sauce splashed on it. However, I tasted the chicken version of the dish, and it was moist and a lot more tasty. I also tasted my co-workers bun bo hue, and I recommend getting that dish over the pho here.   I started sipping on the pho, and it wasn't that bad. It probably tastes a little more watered down than what people are used to. But if you're the kind of person who uses a lot of hoisin, sriracha, and lime juice, I think you will like it.   As I was eating the pho, I noticed my friend's small side of pho broth, and I was like, "Wait. What the heck?" And he said, "Yeah, this is free, and yours is probably not." Then I was wondering if they were going to charge me a lot for the broth.   Later, we went to go pay, and the girl who took my order was also the person at the register. She charged me $4 for the pho broth, and then I said, "Oh..I said I wanted a small bowl." She shrugged and said, "It'll be $18.85." I was like, "What the heck." She talks to my other co-workers in Vietnamese, and then says the cost of my bill in English. I think she definitely knew that I wanted a side broth because I ordered a entree already. And I feel like if she knew my Vietnamese was bad and says my bill in English, why not use my English order instead of my Vietnamese one? Honestly, I'm partially at fault for saying big bowl, but she didn't clarify after I said side broth in English in the beginning.   Come on, man. Why are you so mean.  I got annoyed and told my co-workers about how I thought the server was rude. And one of them jokingly said, "Well, you said (big) bowl." But the others agreed that she most likely knew what I meant. -__- Later, my friend told me that while she was taking my order, she was rolling her eyes as I was talking.   You should try it out if you want to give newer pho restaurants a try or are introducing people who normally don't eat Vietnamese food. I think the presentation of the food and the decor will impress them. Just don't order in Vietnamese to the girl with the glasses who looks like she's being forced to work there. You will probably piss her off, and she will probably get petty.
