In making their broth, it is simmered for a minimum of 24 hours, which results in a hugely flavorful base for the pho. For those that don't care to have some of the more esoteric ingredients in their pho, there are many choices on the menu including a pho made with chicken breast and another one that is vegetarian. The pho is served with a plate of fresh Thai basil, bean sprouts, lime, and jalapeno's for those that like to add to the bowl. I always add some fish sauce which is on the table because I love the flavor of it.  It's hard to describe a bowl of pho except to say it is a meal in a bowl that is huge! If I eat this for lunch, my meals for the day are taken care of, since it is so big. (Yes, they will provide a take out for the rest if you need one.)  For those that prefer something other than pho (there are 16 varieties of pho), there are also 15 other types of soup on the menu, as well as 11 types of salads, 6 vegetarian selections, and a number of steamed rice items as well. Kids are welcome and have their own selections.  Restrooms have always been clean when I have been there, and service is so friendly you feel almost like your eating in a friends house.  I give them 4 stars for service, quality of food, and cleanliness. (And a big YUM for flavor!)

Spicy pho with beef, pork hock, and tendon was very good, if a little fatty on the first visit.  The server noticed I'd picked off the fat and tendon pieces and told me that the tendon was good for the joints- it's the main reason consumers of this style of soup order it.  I told her the main reason I picked them off is bec., visually, the pieces look like fat, and I don't like to chew or swallow pieces of fat.  I managed to salvage some of the tendon to take home.  I'm trying to acquire a taste for them...  LOVED the che bau mau (tri-color bean with coconut milk frozen dessert ($3).  It usually comes with green jelly strings, but I always ask to leave them out.    On my second visit, I took a friend with me and we shared a plate of spring rolls- 2 pieces of  fresh rolls containing pork and shrimp, vermicelli noodles, lettuce, and spring onions wrapped in rice wrapper and served with peanut sauce (I requested mine w/out shrimp).  Honestly, I've had better at other restaurants, including the one across from Un-Pho-Gettable, Com Tam.  This version contained more noodles than meat (Com Tam's version includes a crunchy aspect of pork rind stick!), but I did enjoy the peanut sauce.

Love this place! Very affordable, and great quality food. Everything is very fresh. The staff is very nice and great at making substitutions (I get bean sprouts instead of noodles in my pho). I love their spring rolls (and other fresh rolls) and the hot soups. I only wish they were open later than 8pm! Then I could come here more often. But I definitely recommend this restaurant still! Yummmm!!!!
I love this place! Hands-down they have the best Pho and spring rolls in town. I have been coming here for years and the service is consistently excellent as is the food!
A handy little stop in the Mekong Plaza.  Large, cheap and bustling.  All the usual choices plus some more.  Big portions but all the dishes we had did not stand out as anything more remarkable

After hearing all the raves and rants from our Asian friends, I checked out the Mekong Plaza today, and of course had to start tasting every single restaurant on that premise.  unPHOgettable was our first choice, because bf wanted Pho. He got Pho with raw beef, I got the combo rice plate (eggroll, grilled pork chop and jumbo chicken wing). We shared spring rolls for appetizer.  Spring rolls show quality. Each roll was packed with thin slices of pork, and 3 good size shrimps. There was not a lot of herbs, just shredded lettuce. While I was impressed by the amount of pork and shrimp, the roll tasted dry and not very refreshing. It felt "over-stuffed" if it makes any sense.  The Pho was alright. Their stock was oily. Most Pho restaurants I've been to here in the US use "clear" stock. Even in Vietnam, my family and I specifically avoid the "oily stock" (you have 2 options: clear or oily). The taste overall was... alright. It felt like it was missing something. It tasted good at the tip of the tongue, but ended there. It was not flavorful enough to make you "want to slurp down the whole bowl" - said bf.  The rice was, again, alright. It came with a small bowl of soup (which is the stock for egg-noddle soup. It's pretty oily as well). The chicken wing would have tasted better had they not batter-fried it. The pork chop was tender and flavorful however.   Overall experience was OK. We were full, but feeling unsatisfied.  Price range: appetizers are about $3.50, main entrees are about $8.50

Since this is Arizona and I'm biased towards California Viet places, I'm going to have to give this place 4 stars. The pho isn't that most amazing I've had, but it's not bad. It's good for the craving and it's better than lots of other places around here in Phoenix. I gave 4 stars because the food is average (if you've had Cali places before) but I gave the extra star because the service is a plus! They're really friendly and are attentive to you. I'll go again, it's probably the best I can get while out here in Phoenix.
Best pho ever! I travel 100% for work and eat pho in every city! Not only was it the best Pho Tai, but the staff and owners treat everyone like family!
Best PHO in the Phoenix metro area. It's my go to spot. Everytime I eat here, I head to Tea Snow afterwards for thai iced tea w/ boba
I had a great bowl of Pho yesterday. The services were fantastic!!

Unphogettable is awesome...other than the name being quite unforgettable, the food and service is too! Their food is delicious. Great flavors and  really fresh. They definitely take the time to get to know their customers and teaching them about how to properly eat pho. You might be wondering what I'm talking about but there is a way to mix the sauce in the tiny bowl to dip the meat in etc. Anywho, the price is alright, I think its the typical price per plate but totally worth it.  Definitely try the shrimp spring roll. One word: Heavenly!  Bottom line...I recommend this place for those who love great service and UNFORGETTABLE pho! ;)

I thought this place was ok.  It's in a strip mall, but once I got inside, I almost felt like I was in a mall food court area due to the interior connecting entrance to the food market.  Servers were nice and prompt. Almost a bit too prompt, actually.  I felt slightly rushed when they brought me my bill as I was finishing my Chicken Pho.  I hat still yet to finish when they came around again to see if the bill was ready for them to close it out.  Pho was ok, but I've had better in the Far East Mesa area and I don't really know if I would drive out of my way again to go back to this place.

Best pho I have found. My friend and I have "Pho Phridays" and eat there every time we want pho. Fresh ingredients every time and everyone there is super friendly. They remember their regulars and make sure to seek us out to make sure everything is to our satisfaction. I highly recommend this restaurant!
This is a great Vietnamese restaurant with exceptional service and delicious food. My daughter introduced me to this restaurant and it's one of our favorites.

From the time walked in 4 different people waited on my table. I felt like they truly were going to make this a great experience.  Ordered Pho Ga and it was very good...the noodles were just right but broth seemed a little weak (diluted) and the cilantro and jalapeño very sparse.  The wait staff was very good I would give them a 5.  I will return and try again.
The service was nice, waitress was polite and friendly.  The spring rolls were the worst I have every tasted.  The pho was not very good, lacked flavor.

I have been to unPhogettable about 5 times now! I have not been disappointed! Spring rolls are delicious and my Pho of choice is the #13! The portion size is perfect and the staff is friendly and very fast. I would have give it a 4.5 but the rating scale doesn't let me choose that.

Excellent Pho in any flavor or meat.  Their pork chops with rice is not what I expected with super thin slices of pork with a large heaping cup of rice.  And a few slices of lettuce and carrots  Service is fast and The Pho comes out just about when you're done with appetizers.    Fried spring  rolls are too small.  Fresh pork and shrimp rolls are decent.

This place is pretty good and a solid four stars but ultimately phogettable. The broth was very good but the meat itself was mediocre, chewy and low quality - certainly not what I expect from a nine dollar bowl. The portion size was good and the veggies and sauces were fine but the so so meat really keeps me from wanting to go back. Which is too bad because the broth was so good.  I also had their spring rolls which were awesome. Service was quick and good.

This place is always good, i've had the grilled chicken vermicelli, pork vermicelli, and grilled pork spring roll, all have always been awesome.  I always say i'm going to try the pho, but getting going back to the vermicelli.  Food is fresh and service is good.

When we lived in Mesa, we LOVED coming here. Just as awesome as our pho experiences in Seattle. UnPhogettable is where it's at. Really nice family who owns it, and great service to boot. It's just too bad it's usually hot outside in Arizona, or else I'm sure we would have come here for a nice hot bowl of pho and some spring rolls even more often.
The pho is so yummy and ingredients are fresh! The staff is super friendly.
this is the best pho broth around it has everything you would want in good pho...it's clear, the taste is amazing, and oh so yummy...the staff is awesome too

Yeah NEW PLACE in place of Pho Van (did not like the owner nor service at Pho Van): New Owners, New Interior, Great Service, Very Nice STAFF and the food is very good. I've been to the sister restaurant in Mekong Palace in Mesa. I like this one better because it is closer to me, the food seems the same.  I met 2 friends here, we started off with the A2 (2 soft spring rolls) and then #6 (Pho with lean rare steak, well done flank and tripe), #7 (Pho with tendon and tripe) # S1 (Central region spicy beef based noodle soup with flank, brisket and pork hock). All the food was very fresh, and tasted great. My only minor comment would be all 3 bowls of soup could of been hotter in temperature, other than that, excellent!  Atmosphere: very nice, Service: excellent (nice that the owner checks on customers), Food: very good

I'm always in search for good pho and trust me I've been to a lot of Pho places with my friends. Located in Mekong Supermarket, this by far is one of the best ones. Atmosphere nice, service was excellent and food was excellent. We arrived at 11:30 and by 12:00 it was packed.  We ordered the Soft Spring Rolls with Shrimp and Pork and the #6, Pho with Lean Steak, well-done Flank Steak and Tripe. My friend had #10 Pho with Lean Steak and well-done Flank Steak. The broth was delicious. Portion of noodles to broth to all the goodies, all evenly balanced.  Atmosphere: Nice, Service: Excellent, Pho: Excellent
Delicious pho and spring rolls. Will be returning when the craving hits again. The service was great.

My family love this place! My husband has celiac and this is where he could safely order delicious food without worrying about gluten. We usually order rice noodles with book tripe and beef tendons. My daughter likes their rare beef rice noodle soup.  Even my Asperger son (extremely picky eater) likes their beef broth so much he would just have rice noodles in broth.  I like their spring rolls with pork and shrimp slices. Not too expensive for being hand made.  We add it when we feel like splurging a little.  If you are on a GF diet you need to avoid the hoisin sauce and regular soy sauce. I am not sure about the peanut sauce. Since I do not know how it is mixed. I am giving it 4 stars because I feel while the flavor has been consistent, the portion is a bit smaller.  I remember we used to get more "stuff".

I go to unPhogettable all the time because I always order the Pho, but more than that. The summer rolls are better than any other place I've been!  I always get this one. A2 Nem NÜ§ng Cun (2 Soft SUMMER Rolls)?????????? $4.95 (Fresh rice paper rolls with Vietnamese pork sausage served with house special sauce). It's not hard to find good Pho, but these things are worth the trip alone for me.

Excellent Pho. S1 (spicy beef soup) is tasty but not really spicy at all. Service is excellent. Wish they came with more jalepeno slices (3 on the plate of basil/sprouts). Nice to have sriaracha, chili paste, hoison, fish oil and soy sauce on the table.   Will be back for sure!

We just got done having an early dinner here and it was excellent! My boyfriend had the beef Pho and I had the chicken Mi Ga. Absolutely flavorful and just all out delicious! The staff was friendly and was courteous as well as accommodating when we let them know of my boyfriend's shellfish allergy. They actually helped him pick a safer broth. The portions are huge so we'll have plenty for lunch tomorrow too. I can't wait to come back here! This place truly is unPhogettable!
My family and I love eating here, we've tried Pho at other places around the east valley and nothing else compares. Great staff and owners run the place and we've never had bad service. Delicious!!!

Definitely worth my drive coming all the way from Maricopa! My family and I ate here and came back the very next day, that's how good it was, yes we had to have it again! My husband ordered the seafood pho he love it, I ordered the brisket pho, I loved it! We also ordered chicken spring rolls, shrimp spring rolls, chai tea, and I ordered the freshly squeezed sparkling lime aid which is my fav Vietnamese drink and it definitely was up to my standards! Everything was delicious and the service was very exceptional!! We will most definitely be coming back again and again and again

I had to go with 5 stars...I'm SOOOO picky and this place hit all my sweet spots. Awesome local owner...fresh ingredients...no chemicals or MSG....authentic and just really, really good and the price point is right on too. I had #4 Pho and veggie spring rolls and we shared the fried rice. Yum Yum Yum! We will be back.

FAN! If this place wasn't so far from me, i would it eat it everyday, twice a day   The broth was a good balance. Not one spice stood out too much maintaining the flavorful balance of broth.  Get there early. I was there at 11am for lunch and already there were 6 tables filled.
Great food with quick and friendly service. The vegetarian pho is surprisingly healthy and tastes great with vegetable broth. Everything else I've tried here is a hit too.

I judge every Pho place by their Pho Tai.   unPhogettable's pho has an incredible broth. They also don't skimp on the pho toppings (I should really learn what these toppings are called--it's the dish with the basil, sprouts, jalapenos, limes, etc). I like the atmosphere of this restaurant because you can exit to the parking lot in the front or to the Asian market area in the back which reminds me of the small malls strewn about in the semi-urban areas of Japan and Thailand.   Only issue I have with this place is the price. You have to pay $8+ per bowl while Saigon Pho in Chandler is $5-6 and has better pho and quicker service.  Pho kind of reminds me of Chipotle. The heavily frequented Chipotles tend to have the best quality food (this is anecdotal but I am a former manager of Chipotle so I'd like to think I speak from legitimate experience). I'm talking tightly rolled, good salsa and sour cream distribution, the works. They simply get more practice and it shows. The unfrequented Chipotles tend to suffer in overall food quality. This goes for Saigon and unPhogettable in the same way. unPhogettable just doesn't have as many people come through so they don't really have the pho experience down to a science (yet). Nonetheless, you'll still enjoy great food and a nice walk through the market afterwards.
I must be busy Instagraming photos when I'm here... Even with the drive my favorite pho place in AZ. So many veggies and so much vegan broth and happiness. Always my numba 1

Our food here is usually decent, expensive for what you get, but decent However, this time I ordered the beef curry stew and it was DISGUSTING! Watered down broth and nothing but globs of fat and a few shreds of beef. The "manager" doesn't have a clue. Pathetic. None of us will return.

I wanted to like this place since location is convenient and the restaurant is clean. But the bowl of pho was overpriced for just mediocre broth and skimpy filling. I think I'll stick with the neighboring pho places from now on.

Not terrible but not the best. I eat a lot of pho, this doesn't make me an expert, I am aware of this, but all I can provide is my honest opinion. I had pho with flank steak and tripe. The steak was a little tough, the pho itself was not very flavorful relative to many others I have had in the valley. It did not taste bad by any means, but that flavor explosion that you usually get in your mouth with pho just wasn't there. I will have to give them a second chance, maybe it was an off day.

Had very good reviews so I gave it a try. It's in a weird place, attached to a grocery store. Had the Shrimp and chicken fresh summer rolls and they were good. Ordered the beef and we'll done brisket pho and it was good. Broth was tasty. Lots of meat and noodles. Brought both almost right away. Like a little time to eat my rolls before soup shows up but not a big deal. Had the Thai ice tea and it was good but done with shaved ice, almost like a snow cone. Very good and would go back

I have gone to their other location many times before and was excited to hear that they opened a new location a little closer to home. Their pho broth is definitely 5 stars and I love their beef stew! The only reason I'm giving 4 stars is because their coconut drink didn't come in the usual whole coconut that I love.. so I was disappointed. it was just a few slices of coconut inside coconut water so I felt that it wasn't worth it. the price is also a little more expensive that other local Vietnamese restaurants. But the staff is very friendly and the restaurant is always clean.
This place is so incredible. The staff is ridiculously nice and the Pho well worth it. I will probably be coming here at least once a week!

I got the beef bun with egg rolls and the meat was SO good! My friends kept stealing beef off my plate. The noodles had a bit of a funny taste to me, but I haven't had enough of this dish from other restaurants to say if that taste is normal or not. The greens that came with the dish were fresh and flavorful.   The gentleman who rang up my to-go order was SUPER nice and hospitable. I received EXCELLENT customer service for the 4 minutes I was actually in the restaurant.

This is about as good as it gets! The pho here is fantastic and the portions are large.  The owners and staff are very personable and make you feel at home.  I try to eat here as often as I can and it's always a wonderful experience...can't go wrong here.
First visit and service and food was fantastic. Well be coming back.

Don't come here for bun Bo hue! I got here in the morning when they just opened 10' ago & ordered bun bo hue (spicy beef noodle soup) & it came out too salty, doesn't beef flavor in the soup, just water & beef & it costs $ 9.75/ bun Bo hue. My fresh coconut came out in a glass & taste like sugar water. They must made different process with this coconut juice. I wasn't happy w my food at all but the staff was nice to me for my 2 stars review.
Great pho very nice staff and owner. Right next to a huge Asian market.
This is a total gem in the desert.  The pho here is of comparable quality to pho in the Bay Area or east coast.  I strongly recommend eating here!

We have been to the Mekong Plaza location many times in the past, so we were happy to see this location pop up as it is a lot closer to our home. We ordered our usual pho with sliced chicken breast and it was delicious as always! This location seemed a lot cleaner than the other one and they got our order correct when in past we have gotten home with the wrong items.

Food is good here. I ordered number one of the menu which got lots of meat. HOWEVER!!! The blonde hair girl who served us is really BAD.Actually, I didn't feel any service at all. Her face seemed like I owed her money! Our table run out of the sauce, the other waitress brought it to us.At the same time, I had no idea where she was.  I will never come back.
Great Pho!! It's a must try. I ordered the V4 and it was delicious. Staff is friendly and very attentive.
Fine Pho.  Nice atmosphere.  Great service.

I'm really not a fan.  But I could be bias because I lived in So Cal, and grew up eating San Gabriel Valley and Garden Grove pho really makes you a pho connoisseur.  My boyfriend did warn me to lower my expectations but for a place that has this many good reviews I would imagine it being good. I don't think I got my pho fix, the portions are small.  Gave it an extra star because the staff are really attentive and nice.

My friend took me here about 3 months ago, so the review is a little late.  After a night at the casinos, we all felt like pho the next morning.  I wasn't expecting much because Hawaii in my mind has the best Pho, but I was pleasantly surprised here.   Service was awesome, great...rare beef pho, and crispy egg rolls.  It's nice to know that a place like this exists.  I've tried others in the valley, and this way better than those!
Best Pho ever and menu item S2 is amazing.  please open a location in chandler/gilbert!
With the name like un-pho-gettable, how could I not try this Vietnamese restaurant!  Great atmosphere, attentive, kind, & prompt service :) great prices :) great fresh & flavorful food!

This is easily one of my FAVORITE restaurants. Whether or not you're a pho fan, you should have your first experience of pho at this location. You'll instantly be hooked by their incredibly speedy service & delicious food. I've been here about 20 times now and continue to bring new friends each time. These new friends become obsessed with UnPhogettable and we often cannot compare the food nor service with any other pho location. On that note, despite your location, I still will always recommend UnPhogettable on Dobson Rd when you're in need of some reasonably priced large portions and a comfortable environment. It's worth the drive !

Its rare for me to want to give a pho restaurant five stars. Usually they either lack in service or cleanliness or tastes like msg. But no, this restaurant really lives up to it's name   The mom and I came here before grocery shopping inside Mekong. The staff were really friendly and speedy in taking orders. It did take a while for our pho's to come out but they say it's because they make everything in order of ticket. Made to order pho?? I can't complain.  Meanwhile, it being our first time there, we decided to indulge in their spring rolls. There was nothing but shrimp, lettuce and noodle in the roll but surprisingly, flavorful.   We get the pho. The soup tastes clean and fresh. There seemed to be lots of cilantro in it which I LOVEEEED and my mom loved how it didnt taste like they poured in MSG. Large portion of noodles, lots of meat, and clean bean sprouts!! Perfect for a hungry stomach. Definitely unPHOgettable =p
Great food and service!  Lots of variety on the menu, but the special part was how accommodating they were to our toddler.  Even brought out a pair of scissors so we could cut her food up.

Pho Tai here was A-ok  Was happy to see all the condiments around as well as fish sauce. (Sriracha was in a generic plastic bottle instead of its namesake package)  A strong force in Pho-land in Pho-enix would like to see some more noodles/meat to bump it up to the level of SF Pho places.

Let's start off by saying the name of this place is hilarious, which is the whole reason for my visit. I went this past Saturday, very nice place, nice waitresses, food came out fast. I just wasn't impressed with the Pho. The egg rolls were good and spring rolls as well. I probably will not visit this place again and just stick to Da Vang.

Just recently moved to Phx and have had many people refer me to this restaurant for pho. I have been here on numerous occasions and have had the best food every time.  I prefer the #13 and the fried egg rolls. The vegetarian egg rolls are very delicious as well.

Stopped in here tonight at the recommendation of fellow Yelpers. This place did not disappoint. It was very clean, unlike some Vietnamese spots I have been to, and the staff was prompt, attentive and friendly. My friend and I both ordered Pho. I had the #9 and it was awesome. The broth was full of flavor and delicious. We also shared an order of the fried rice. Which was wonderful as well. It was non-greasy and full of goodies. I am definitely a fan and will be returning.

One of the best pho and other delights around. The service and owners are so sweet and awesome. They have lots of regulars, Asian and otherwise, which says a lot in my book. My kids' favorite place, and they don't even have crayons.
This was so good and they have a great selection of food. Not just Pho so you got a little bit of everything!  We have found a new place to come and eat !!!

Can't beat #44 beef stew with rice.. yummy :) a little pricey then other pho places and their service is just okay.. but their beef stew always have been consistent every time I got it at their original location by Mekong palace and here tonight.
The food is very good here and the portions are larger than other Pho restaurants. The pho base is very tasty.

Best Pho in the valley!!! Fresh brewed Thai and jasmine Ice tea. Easy parking and very friendly wait staff.  They close a little early, 8 pm, even on the weekend.  The menu is large but we've only tried the pho since that is our favorite.

My new favorite Pho place in the Valley!    The restaurant was spotless and the service was impeccable.  The owner came by our table personally to apologize for our 5 minute wait for a table and he stayed behind to make small talk with my little girl about her Little Mermaid doll that she had with her.  I thought he was really friendly and gracious and he definitely made this the most friendly Vietnamese restaurant I've ever dined at in the Valley.  The food was extremely delicious.  I got the Bo Kho soup and it was fantastic; hot, meaty and flavorful.  My husband had a vegetarian stir fry and my son got the vegetarian Pho and they both loved their dishes as well.  My little daughter also really enjoyed her fried spring rolls and her fresh, young coconut drink that comes served in a glass, along with the coconut meat and a serving spoon.  This restaurant is a little farther from me than I would like, but I'll definitely try to make it a regular stop when I am over in this part of the Valley.

BEST PORK CHOPS EVER! If you want to take a mini foodcation head over to Mekong Market in Mesa AZ for some of the best Pho in AZ. My first visit involved a romantic dinner date with a succulent, spicy piece of pork that dances on your tastebuds before finding a happy home in your tummy! (Now I am officially drooling) I'm sure everything else is just as good but I cannot stop ordering these darn chops! Once I get the recipe I will bump them up to 5 stars, until then I will continue to dream of this sweet ,sweet pork until we meet again.
After hearing great things about this place, I finally tried it out. Didn't like it at all because their rare steak tasted funny. Won't be returning.

I was very excited to find a place that has vegan pho, well they call it vegetarian noodle soup, but close enough! My husband got the wide noodle dish, which I liked from the few bites I snuck in.   Overall it was good, but it didn't blow me away. I'll keep my eye out for another vegan pho in the area, but if I can't find one, I will definitely go back. Gotta have my noodles!

My sister and I have been in search of a new Pho spot after ours closed. After countless taste tests at multiple restaurants, we've found "the spot." We love their Pho and I would highly encourage other Pho snobs to try!  We always take to-go so I can't comment on the atmosphere but the other dishes we've tried are all great as sell. Solid and consistent.

I've tried the bun and the pho... both are great! The child claims this place serves the best broth, high praise from a super picky eater.  Great service, great food, great prices... worth a drive to check it out.

Great service, a little more upscale than a traditional Vietnamese restaurant. English speaking (a plus!) But, because it is a little bit on the nicer side...the price of a bowl of Pho is pricier. Not by much- just a couple bucks.

This is by far my favorite pho restaurant. The owner is great and remembers us when we come in and always makes sure we are happy. I don"t live in the area, but when I make it to town I am sure to go there. The pho varieties are diverse and they cook the broth for 24hrs. They also have my favorite dessert that you can"t always find. Love it!
Soup was hot, fresh & oh so yummy and the service was fast & friendly. I'm glad we found this place!

Lives up to its name, unforgettable!!!  Though the place looks cheap, the food is incredibly delicious. The waitress are really sweet and customer oriented.  This is my first time here and would definitely recommend reading the review to try this place.  I had a rice vermicelli pho with tofu and veggies. The veggie broth was pure delight added to it the veggies and tofu was right steamed and stir fried.   One of the best Vietnamese food!!

Ok.... so first the good, very clean, great location, tons of options, friendly staff. All super important. So why the three stars??? Well, while the pho is good it is not mind blowing. It's everything pho should be and the portions of meat they give are very generous. But it's not that pho stock that wraps your soul in warmth.  The real issue I have is that they Nickel  and dime ya to death ( very unattractive in a restaurant) if you want your order to go, .50 if you want your rare steak on the side .50 if you want sliced onions on the side 1$....I get that these things take a little extra time, I've worked in restaurants for many years, but with soooooooo many choices when it comes to going out ( like 10 pho places with in 2 miles) these little extras should be included.  They add so much to the dinning experience, and are if given free would be so much more valuable then the .50 they pocket.  Would I come back?.... if I was in the area maybe.... would I seek it out? Nope.
Food was good, I enjoyed the broth in the Pho but wow was it PRICEY!  I left with 3 Pho take out and spent $36.   Other spots near by that are just as good and a fraction of the price.

I am sorry unPhogettable. I am sorry it took me so long to get here. I was told by many about your greatness, but I still took the longer route. At least I got here and now I am here to stay. Your service is awesome. Our waitress, who I think owns the place, was so helpful. The food was delicious. I had an amazing thai tea that was not too sweet, which they usually tend to be. The vermicelli chicken noodles tasted great. Even the dessert of fruit and coconut was great. I had a wonderful time and will be coming back soon!

We eat pho all over the country. This is our favorite place. The broth is wonderful and it is so meaty. They also have a place on the menu that charges minimal for extras such as sides of streak or added vegetables. The veggies might be an Americanized version, but we love our pho but still need our veggies, so it works for us.

What the Pho? Why haven't I heard about this place sooner? This place is Pho-licous!   My classmate and I ordered:  Pho Dac Biet Bo Vien (Pho with rare steak, well-done flank, marble brisket, tendon, tripe & beef meatballs) Gi Cun (2 Soft Spring Rolls) Soda Chanh (Club soda with fresh squeezed lime juice & ice)  The classmate I went with loves this place. She says its the closest place in Arizona to her bf's San Francisco restaurant. Usually, I only eat Pho and drink water since the portion is too big for me. This time, I ate spring rolls, the ENTIRE bowl of Pho, and drank the lemonade-soda. The soda was sweet and made me want more. I left feeling very full and happy! It was an unPhogettable experience! =)

Its hard to find real good Pho in town. And this place makes it alot easier. This is place has great vietnamese food. It will make your mouth watery. Typical L.A. asian atmosphere as far as style of the restaurant. But its not really expected when you walk into most asian restaurants. However, what is expected is the food and it is delicious here.   An extremely friendly place. Typical asian family working behind the counter.  Un-phogettable surely lives up to its reputation!   My only problem is that it closes too early.  but I understand for the family reasons.

I love pho. I really do. I love all Asian noodle soups in general now that I think about it - udon, ramen, pho. Yum.  Anyway, unPhogettable!  Excellent excellent service. Super friendly employees that take note of what you want or do not want in your pho. Large portions. Great quality meat. And delectable broth. Though, as I always do, I added a ton of sriracha and hoison to make it even more delicious. Ohmygosh my mouth is watering at the thought.   Also - I'm usually not a huge fan of shrimp spring rolls, I tend to find them somewhat blah, but the shrimp spring rolls here are quite enjoyable!  I will definitely be returning so I can try the bun bo hue :]

It was neat being able to ride the train over to Mekong Market to finally check the place out. I like Vietnamese food, and thought this would be a great place to try.  My opinion remains mixed of this place after a day of thinking about it. The service is flat out odd. They just walk up and stare at you, as if they are waiting for the next command. No how many for lunch, what do you want for lunch, etc. They just look at you.   I enjoyed my lunch well enough, but what killed it for me and pretty much decided two things is they had shredded lettuce in my dish, and the price. I know the rent here is higher, but it was about 2-3 more than most Vietnamese restaurants per entree.

3.75-4 stars I had the #16 (I think) the veggie Pho.  No complaints. Good service, quick and friendly. I think the only negative about this place is that it closes at 8. If you are looking for a late dinner, this isn't the place. Otherwise, recommend.

Came in right at 9am, why not? Pho for breakfast it is! So I should say we came to place when they very first opened and it was not good. So it's been a few years and since then I must admit, things have changed. Pho has flavor and I actually finish my bowl. Heard they have another location too now.

Ordered take out & they tried to charge me more than double! I ordered Pho Chin $7.75 w/additional cup of soup $1.00. And asked for x-tra limes. They told me the price was 16.89!!! They said they had to charge all this extra prices for take out! WTF??? I've eaten here several times & gotten takeout with always the same things with no crazy extra charges. It was the old woman who told me this charge. Usually I deal w/the young girls or the guy. I will never order/eat here again! Someone get a tight rein on grandma before she pulls this bs w/ other customers. Also found they have Dirty Dining News Report!! Gross!

Simply the best pho in the valley.  The broth is outstanding.  The owners are always coming around to the tables to make sure you are happy.  The spring rolls are also great.  I have had pho in at least 20 different Vietnamese restaurants around the country and this is the best.
Best Pho place in town. Their secret is in the broth which enhanced everything in the soup especially the rice noodles.  I would drive 20 miles just for their Pho.
One of the best pho place in Phoenix. Absolutely no MSG!!

Amazing Pho can be hard to find, but they always amaze us. My father and I come here so often the owners know us by name and greet us kindly. I always get the crunchy spring rolls (they're to die for) along with the Shrimp pho. My father gets the meatball Pho. Both are delicious! Since I am unsuccessful with chop sticks the waiters are always able to provide me with scissors so I can use a fork. I love this place and will continue to come back!

Coming from the Bay Area in NorCal, where my mom had a Vietnamese restaurant for 7 years, I have high expectations and this is one of the first places whereI have enjoyed the pho and the fresh spring rolls!  Delicious and I will definitely be back.
This place is one of my favorites when it comes to Pho.  Great food.  Friendly service.  Family owned.

I been here countless times. I think their Pho is very excellent taste as good as my parents make them. However, the pricing on Pho here is very high, where I can go elsewhere and get the same quality, maybe even with more traditional flavored, for cheaper. I would come back but only if I have a really high craving, since it's in Mekong plaza, the Asian supermarket is right next to it. Very convenient spot.
This restaurant is clean, and the Vietnamese food is authentic. The portions are generous, and the service is fast. Nice name for a Pho place.

Being from California and having tried many different pho houses, I was pleasantly surprised with the food quality at unphogettable. I was with a group of 15 people during a pretty packed lunch rush, yet the service was quick and attentive. If I'm ever back in this part of Arizona, then I'll surely go back to eat there. Overall, good prices, good service, good food. Yeah, it was pretty unphogettable.

Best Pho I have had in Arizona!  Great atmosphere, clean and classy. Pho is amazing they were quick efficient and friendly. Spring rolls were to die for. First place in Arizona to rival my favorite place back home in Colorado. The name says it all unPhogetable!

Been really wanting the try pho. Ready a couple review and this place seamed to have the best reviews for mesa. Place was very clean and  simple. I ordered the #28 that's what the waiter recommend. The restaurant was packed so I was really surprised at how fast the food came out. I would say it was within 10min. I really wanted to try oxtail but that was not an option on the menu so I was a little disappointed. I felt like it was really American and not truly authentic. It had a nice sweet taste to it. Meat was tender. I like the Basile leaves they give you to put in the soup really tops off the flavore. I was just expecting more condiments to come with it. After my food was brought out I never saw the server agen till I waved some one down to get my check. Was a cool place to try happy I did I just wouldn't come back agen.

Best and cleanest place ever for vietnamese food! I highly recommend it give it a try it seriously the best one i have tried so far!! Their service is great they remember you and its very fair in price! I recommend this place for anyone who wants to try vietnamese food!!

Simply excellent!   Service was excellent and food came out lightening quick.   We ordered several different types of Pho which were all delicious! Thai iced coffee was also splendid. Been there twice in 2 days so far and likely many times in the future. Two thumbs up
The broth and noodles here are awesome, so fresh! This is my favorite out of all the Pho places I've been.

We tried the S1 Bun Bo Hue which is a fragrant Vietnamese Spicy Beef Noodle soup. The bun bo hue came out well could even be spicier for me.   Spring rolls: they tasted fresh a little over priced 4.50 for only two. I didn't like the peanut sauce because they added coconut milk to it had a funny after taste.  I got the pho #2. Overall not bad we might come back because the restaurant was cleaner & decorated a little nicer  than most pho places. Service could be friendlier & overpriced for a pho place..
Pho was amazing!!!! This was my first Pho experience, but I loved it! I am coming back!   Had the number #13, lean pork. They gave me a lot, I could not finish it.

We love this place. The owners are super attentive and the service is fast, friendly and efficient. We all have our faves: Veggie Autumn Rolls, the beef or chicken pho, the vermicelli salad with grilled chicken, the fried rice (ask for their housemade chili sauce - WOW!), the fresh coconut drink, the thai tea, the soda water & lime, their dessert with shaved ice and jellied fruits. Gah!! So many good things!! (stop by the bakery next door to take some goodies for tomorrow's breakfast!)

Delicious! Great service! Our server was very accommodating and told me that I could pretty much order my pho custom made to my specs, with a specific noodle and how much broth, meat and so on..... We have yet to go back since our last visit in the Spring because it's been too darn hot! We'll definitely become regulars when the weather drops below 90! :D

If vegetarian people wanna try some Vietnamese cuisine this could be your next destination.  Pho that you get here is unbelievable.  Pho is a noodle soup with vegetables. I ordered v4 item with egg noodles. It was awesome. The broth was so tasty that I could have gone for another round. A welcome place for vegetarian people.

Not bad but not great either. My husband had the beef based pho and I had the chicken based pho.  Both were just OK nothing great.  I have had other soups that are far better for far less cost.  I ordered the seafood and veggie and according to the menu, it was to have imitation crab but I did not find a single piece in the dish.  The dish came with 2 shrimp (the best thing in the dish).  The calamari was inedible as it was sooooooooooooo tough. The salmon fish balls had a weird consistency to them and didn't taste anything at all like salmon.  I tried my husbands brisket and preferred mine over his.  He wasn't crazy about his either.  The portion sizes are way to big and if you take it home, it will be no good later because noodle soups become gross later. Not a place I would probably return to.  Just saying...................

The pho is 4 out of 5 stars. Been over about 10 times, but I don't find myself coming back here often.  The portions are a bit smaller and the prices are a bit higher compared to other Vietnamese restaurants.  Don't get me wrong, this place is worth eating at. But it's not one of my top 5s.

Okay, personally I would give their pho five stars; however, I recently brought a friend here who was not so much into getting soup. He ordered the number 50, which was rice and shrimp. For the price I really thought he would get more food, but it was literally five shrimp that were so incredibly tiny and a scoop of rice. Everyone at the table was frantically taking food off their plates to give to him since there was no way that was going to even fill him up a little bit. The pho is absolutely delicious, but I'll never order anything other than pho here seeing what you get for the price.

This was my first time visiting this location, and first time trying pho.  The restaurant is busy and clean.  Service is impeccable, there's a constant "how's everything, need anything else?" From staff.  Our food was ok, more meat would be better but hey I will come back again and try other dishes.
Hands down the best pho spot in AZ. The beef pho is so flavorful. The service is awesome. The staff is very attentive with drinks, dishes, etc. Will always come back here!

This did not disappoint!  We were actually going to the Thai restaurant next door.  But then my kiddos wanted pho!  We came at about 7:30pm.  We had to wait for about 5 mins.  The servers were very promptly in getting us our drinks and then orders. We ordered the egg rolls, very good.  Didn't care too much for the spring rolls.  We liked the shrimp past rolls better.    Other than that, the menus is very extensive ---but if you looked around and see what other people got, it was 80% pho!  So yes!  When in doubt, get the pho.  We all got pho and it was pretty good.  The other plus is the 3 bean dessert drink was also yummy.

This was the first place that I tried pho so I did not want to review it until I tried other places as well. Now that I am obsessed with pho and I have tried other places I think this will be the go to pho place in Pho-enix! Don't leave here without trying the coffee either!

Great name and great Pho what more can I ask for?? :)    I have been going around town since I moved here searching for great Pho as it was a weekly eat back home in Seattle.  Finally I found a place within 15 min of my house to go get some especially to cure the mighty hangover.    The Pho was voted best dish in 2009 here and I can see why.  The broth was full of flavor and the meat was a generous portion and on my order of Pho Tai it actually was rare as it was served to me unlike many other Pho places where it is already cooking in the broth and far from rare upon arrival to me.    The menu had many options on it besides just Pho and I ordered my usual Vietnamese egg rolls which were great as well.  They had shrimp in them so it was a nice seafood twist to the usual pork rolls.    Overall it is a great place to cure your Pho need or cure that hangover.  The only thing preventing it from being a 5 star is that it borders the grocery store and doesn't really capture that separate restaurant vibe it should.
Great food! The pho is phonomenal hehehe the pun. Only complaint service was a bit lacking. But easily improved. Will phoso go again.

Lovely staff! always a plus when dining in.  Tried the meatball Pho and it was very good!! ended up taking more than 1/2 home. Very generous portions! Menu has a good variety as well. They also have other entrees besides pho... but it is called unPhogettable, so try the pho foo, it is quite delish!
Great menu options, clean and friendly staff.  The prices are a little high for the portions but overall the food quality was good.

For the last 5 years I have eaten at UnPhogettable, I have nothing but positive memories to share.  I ate here when my family and friends came into town for my graduation, and my friend's going away party was held at UnPhogettable. My parents talk about how good the pho was the last time they visited, and my boyfriend thinks their veggie pho is better than anywhere else.  I love that the same waitress that served me 5 years ago is still happy to see me when I come to dine, and I always enjoy the casual conversations I have with the owners each time I visit.  I think I feel like a part of the family when I enter this place, and perhaps that's why this restaurant is unforgettable in my opinion.  My favorite is #21 (seafood pho), but I have had most of the things on the menu by stealing some bites from my friends here and there.  The veggie pho (#23) is refreshing and has a clean after taste.  The rare steak and brisket (#9) seems to be a good choice for a person who has never tasted pho before.  There are plenty of other items on the menu starting from vermicelli bowls and grilled meats.  I think if you want to try some Vietnamese food that is consistently good, UnPhogettable would be a great place for you.
Fresh  Friendly Amazing spring rolls and pho Owner brews her own magical mixture of Jasmin iced tea and its to die for

This is the 3rd Vietnamese restaurant I've visited in the area, and my least favourite. I wavered between a 3 and 4 star review. The service was great, which would generally have bumped my review up to a 4, but they were a little too much. We waited for another family to arrive, and even though we informed them that we would let them know when we were ready, I think we were asked if we needed service about 8 times before we finally ordered.   This restaurant is located in the Mekong shopping plaza. Maybe it's because of this that the standard fare is pricier than other places.  We came in with a group of 9 people, 6 adults and 3 kids after the age of 5.   Food: Food was good. The portions are typical, enough for an adult to be full. The kids got their own bowls of food that were more than enough. I think the kids' meals were under $6.  We ordered the spring rolls, which I found were pretty pricey for what they were. Furthermore, the peanut sauce was not very good. The pho was decent, but not something I'd write home about. I ordered a vermicelli bowl with beef and shrimp. It was tasty, but I just felt like some flavour profile was missing.   Their coconut drink is not fresh - beware. Or maybe it is, and they just dump some extra sugar in the drink for fun.   Service: They were great with the kids and gave them pencil crayons and a colouring page for them to play with while they waited for their food. There were too many servers who didn't communicate. Within 5 minutes, we had what felt like every single waiter in the restaurant come up and ask us what we wanted to order.

Love their Pho!  I think they have the best flavored broth out of any other places I have tried.  Their prices are rather high for essentially a bowl of Top Ramen with some brisket, but it's still quite tasty!  When two of us get Pho and drinks, I believe the total is usally around $20-$25.  If money's tight, there are several cheaper options in the area that are still very good.  My only complaint (again) is the price.  Not sure why noodles, broth, and a few slices of meat are so expensive.

Have been to this place many times. Would visit it twice a week. Such a regular that the server already knew my order. Last time I was there I found a worm in my soup. All they did was offer an apology and that's it. Even though I did not even eat half of my food they still made me pay for it. It's unfortunate that the food is good but treatment to loyal customers is so bad.

I ran into this place while looking for an Asian market. I thought the name was funny but it seemed it got good enough reviews...so why the hell not. I tried their egg noodle soup with everything on it including fish ball, salmon, pork, chicken and what not...I was blown away....this I was very good and by far the best I had.  My gf tried the pho...well....nothing special but seem like the same old pho compared to other established pho places. Also their appetizers...I tried their pork sausage rolls....well they were okay.  Overall good service and fair price.G approved!

I came here with a bunch of my friends after a late night. The service was great and fast. They were super friendly to us! I get my usual pho tai which is super basic with just rare steak and noodles in broth. The broth flavor is decent but not as flavorful as I would like. It's decent quality but I do enjoy other places more. The spring rolls are good and authentic and the sauce is yummy.   Overall, your average pho place. Decently good but not the best I've ever had. :/
I have a cold and was craving pho and this restaurant lived up to its expectations! Large portions, enough to save some for later and delicious broth! Definitely will be back!
An amazing vegetarian noodle soup. The sambal and Sriracha sauces on the table are the best.

Unphogettable is a great restaurant with amazing service. The owner remembered us from when we'd been there the first time. I didn't even think that was possible. :-)  This is a great spot for pho in Mesa, where the options for that are sadly lacking. Their pho has fantastic flavor. If it's your first, definitely try the brisket - you'll love it. We always start with the spring rolls and then go onto our pho.   For the service, I don't think my glass of water or my husband's pop were ever even half empty. The owner stops by all the tables and loves to talk about his restaurant.   This is definitely a place we'll frequent for an inexpensive meal. You really can't beat it.

This is my dad and I favorite lunch spot. Pho-real! Impeccable service and the freshest food. Their spring rolls ate immaculate, fried rice is pretty close to Peruvian friend rice, and their pho is truly unphoghetable. The servers are friendly, the owner always asks you how the food was. Nestled inside the Mekong plaza market this place will meet all your expectations in delicious Vietnamese cuisine.

The service is friendly and fast! The food is delicious. Take out is prepped to be put together at home so it's perfectly cooked. After our second visit the staff recognized us, and not long after they remembered our usual order. Highly recommended!

My wife and I have been coming here for the last 3 years.  We were always happy with the food and service.  However, on this Saturday night we left wondering what was happening to the food.  My wife order a pho dish and I ordered a vegetarian noodle dish.  My wife felt like they had cut down on the fresh ingredient dish and noodles.  My dish seemed like they cut down on the tofu and vegetables and the noodles as well.  This is the first time we left disappointed.   We'll give it another try but if they have a repeat performance of tonight we will write this restaurant off.

I absolutely LOVE this place! High quality ingredients mixed with family recipes and great customer service. I have been to their original location in Mesa but this location is so close to my office this is my new favorite lunch spot. it is also nice enough inside to also be a great relaxed date night as well.

I ordered vermicelli since I had to get take out and they put their soup in styrofoam. The pho smelled great inside. My order of vermicelli was pricey as  heck and half the box was lettuce. Food was mediocre.

I grew up down the street from Little Saigon in The O.C. and this place is just as good as anything I had there. Even better since it's 4mi from the crib. Seriously, their soup is AMAZING. I used to say Pho Ao Sen was my favorite, and, don't get me wrong, it's good, but this place is REAL GOOD.   On top of the great food, the staff is 110% TOP NOTCH. That place is run with precision and the owner is not only very knowledgeable about their fresh good food, he's one of the nicest guys I have ever met. The staff really makes this place, IMO, it just so happens that they have BOMB PHO.  I go here at least 1x's a week, sometimes more.  Oh, and if you have food allergies, they are 100% on point and can direct you toward items that don't contain gluten.
Yummmmy! I love this place.. Only bad thing is that's in Mekong market (which makes me spend too much money). I would come back because service and pho was pho-nomenial! ;)
overall it is a great place for pho~ tried their pho NO.7 and S1~  No.7 is unquestionably delicious, especially for a soup-lover like me~ S1 is kinda okay but would be better if it can be spicier~

Ive only tried the pho, so my review is based only on this.  A little pricier than most of the pho places I frequent, but the portions are a little larger too.  What stands out here is the rich beef broth providing a nice flavor base.  Downside is they could include a little more protein in the pho.  Service is quick and efficient.  We eat here fairly often due to the location at the Mekong Supermarket.  Solid 3 1/2 stars.

Truly unforgettable!!   I've been here easily over 30 times over the course of just a couple of years. I'm a pho-natic and I know great pho when I see, smell, and taste it. I honestly should buy stock in this place - that's how good the pho is! Anyways, I brought two of my besties here last weekend because we were all craving Pho after a fun night out (btw, pho is a great hangover cure!). I got the beef broth-based seafood pho with extra veggies - so delish!! My friends got the chicken pho with extra veggies, and while I didn't try theirs, it certainly looked amazing.   Could not recommend this place enough!
Love this place! The staff is great and they take pride in their food. The pho and vermicelli is delicious! You can't go wrong at this place!

Was looking to try a new Pho spot in the area and I think I found a place to never go anywhere else.  The location is perfect, you can grab Pho then go next door for ice cream that's a win win situation.  First off lets talk about the Egg Rolls, WOW real fresh crisp bite and amazing taste I would come back just for that.  The place is clean and has a lot of space to eat and relax in with TV to watch.  The staff is very friendly, fast and helpful with anything you need.    The Pho is amazing, the broth is probably the best I've had around town with a good amount of noodles.  The vegetable pho gives you more then enough to fill you and the bowl.   Will be back of course!

They don't have very many vegetarian options on the menu BUT the veggie pho option is really good. The staff were friendly and attentive. This place is also within an Asian marketplace type of plaza with a grocery store, ice cream, boba and little vendors in the same area. Pretty cool place to go and check out if you haven't.   I had a really good experience here and keep coming back. Just wish they had more vegetarian options!

One of my fav Pho places in PHX.  It's not as good as what you can find in LA, but it's very satisfying nonetheless.  Great taste, good portion, meat was tender, they use FRESH Pho (not the packaged stuff)....clean environment.  Bun Bo Hue is excellent here as well.

I have to say from a marketing perspective, it was the name that got my attention.  Having said that, I went, and ate.  Coming from TX, my standard is fairly high as we have more than our share of Vietnamese cuisines here.    I got there on a week night with maybe 3 or 4 other tables.  Ordered the combination pho, along with the shrimp/pork spring rolls.  Service was quick as I got my food within 5min of ordering.  First impression was that the size of the bowl seemed smaller than what I've seen, or at least compare to the ones here in TX.  There were only 1 size, so no other options.  Before I put in any condiments and sauce, I always like to taste the soup first as that's usually the most important part of pho.  In this case, I thought the soup has a heavy flavor of tripe.  I ordered the combination, so naturally it has the tripe, which I do enjoy, but just didn't expect the soup itself has that flavor as well.  It was light, and seemed to lack the depth of the typical pho flavoring, with the lemon grass and other flavors.    Overall, it was OK.  Also had the spring rolls.  They too were just OK.  They were quite sticky from what I recall, so not sure if it's been sitting there for awhile?    Overall, I have to say I like the name of this restaurant.  But the food is really just average.  As I was craving some boba drink, but that's one thing they do not have on their menu.  I was also craving a bahn mi, which they also don't have.

We go here pretty much weekly. The staff is super friendly and even remembers my order. Maybe I go a little too much haha.   I get the 15 - the chicken and my girl gets the 13 - beef. There's never mystery meat and the soup is always excellent. I like the consistent quality. The A6 spring rolls are something I HAVE to get each time as well.
For. Pho. I. Eat. Only. Here!:) the only thing is the servers need to have more personality. So shy and quick to leave your table as soon as you ordered.
Very adequate pho, but very bland.  Did the chicken broth which may have been my mistake.  Chicken poached nicely but a little chewy and quite tasteless.  Everything was fresh and amazingly quick.

If you want an authentic food from Vietnam then this is the place. I've eaten here several times and A) the service is awesome B) if your not sure what to order the staff will help you and C) it's always crowded.   I've done most of he appetizers and have not had a bad one. The shrimp rolls are good. The various main dishes all seem the same but each one has subtle flavor differences that make it appear to be a completely different dish.   Can't say enough nice things about this place.
Best Pho in Mesa!! One of my favorite places! Great authentic food, portions are great and the staff is really friendly!! Love this place!!!
Yummmmy!  I get the veggie pho, and its very flavorful and inexpensive.  The broth is fragrant and very delectable.  This is a great place for quality pho with great service.

unPhogettable is PHOnominal! Ok, bad joke aside, this is one of my new favorite Vietnamese restaurants. The food is extremely fresh and after talking with the owner, I found out that they make everything themselves from scratch with no MSG or prepackages meats.   The service was excellent and the cafe setting was very inviting. Although a bit far from my house, I'll make the drive to come back here to eat again.

After bad experience, I will never return.  It is terrible since they didn't meet my expectation and the price is outrageous.  The most difficult part of the Pho is the broth (req 16 hours of preparation) and it tasted like water.  I had to add all kind of condiments to rescue it but can't even eat it.  The restaurant is very slow now and it confirmed what I meant with Asian restaurant.  If your fellow Asians don't patronize the place, it is  because your food did not meet our expectation.  Try across the street to the Rice plate Kim Thanh for their rice dish.  It is night and day.

We now look for a Pho place every time we go on vacation anywhere. Denver has spoiled me since there is one practically on every corner.  We found this one nearby and they were packed at lunch time. There was only 1 size bowl of Pho (what I would call a medium) and I thought it seemed a little on the pricey side, although not completely out of line.  Service was fine here, although I could have used a water refill toward the end and they never came back by.  I ordered the meatball pho and the server asked if I'd ever had it before. I thought that was a little weird, but answered in the affirmative. It did make me wonder if there was something off about it, but it was all fine.  I did NOT care for the taste or texture of the meatballs when they came out. They were very thick cut and really chewy in the center. Did not work for me at all.  I also thought the Pho could've been skimmed a little better, but some places do it better than others, so not too big of a deal.  Overall, I thought it was an okay experience. I don't know that I'd come back and order the meatball.

Great selection of  delicious pho.  Decent prices.  Quick attentive service.  The decor is fairly utilitarian but still the darker colors and authentic Vietnamese decorations make it more than classy enough for a soup joint.  The staff was quick, friendly and attentive.  The fact that there's a great Vietnamese bakery right next door doesn't hurt come desert time, either!
I am very picky with Pho.. This place was amazing! The cold Vietnamese wraps were the best I have ever had!! The shrimp Pho was incredible! Waitress was very polite. I will be back again soon!

this place didn't live up to the hype!  I love pho, and usually I am not picky about broth, but I felt the broth here was really flavorless. on top of that, the beef was pretty tough. and for $8/bowl, I wasn't feeling it.  the positives are that the servers are friendly (although a little too pushy - when my friend asked what drinks they had, the server turned to the back of the menu and insisted on reading through every single item; also we were asked 4 different times what drinks we wanted; AND 4 different times if we were ready to order). also they give you plenty of bean sprouts, mint, and lime for your pho. and it is clean.

The name is frighteningly appropriate.   Our Arizonian hosts are former residents of Oahu, a mecca of Asian cuisine. They know their stuff. After visiting just about every place in Scottsdale and the surrounding area they settled on a new favorite. unPhogettable is a clean and modernly decorated mini-mall storefront. For those of you who aren't familiar Pho it's an incredibly flavorful Thai soup that's actually pretty healthy, depending on the preparation and cuts of meat you decide on. This particular place boasts they're MSG and trans-fat free.  When it came time to order I left it up to our the pros, our hosts, and was so pleased with their recommendations. We started with the Soft Spring Rolls, fresh and simple ($3.45) and Egg Rolls (fried to perfection and accompanied by a tangy sauce ($4.95). My entree was a GIGANTIC bowl of Pho with rare steak (a value at $7.50). I could only eat about half of my portion and that was pushing it. So good.  The only thing better was the service. They were incredibly attentive.

So i found this place on yelp and the reveiws were almost phenomenal! I litteraly went in today and was very disapointed. I must have gotten a new server,  she did not know anything about the menu. She literally came by 1x and never returned. I had asked if they had duck and she just looked at me like i was dumb and said "duck"? Like wtf lol. So when i did finally get my soup that was 10 bucks came with 2 peices of shrimp, tons of lettuce, 1 small peice of chicken, same with the pork. I was so mad i just ate the noodles and left..ill never come back.

My fave pho place in the Valley!  Not only is the food delicious but the service is top notch and the restaurant itself is beautiful (definitely not a hole in the wall!).  The walls feature murals of bamboo and pretty, artistic photos of women wearing traditional Vietnamese dresses.    The place is family-owned and on several of our visits, the owners have come and chatted at length with us--very nice people!  They WILL remember you.  Being vegetarian, I recommend the veggie pho (selection V4 on the menu), which is like a tofu/veggie explosion in a soup bowl; it has mushrooms, broccoli, cauliflower, snow peas, bok choy, cabbage, and tofu plus the bean sprouts/lime/jalapeños that come alongside.  Really fresh and good!  I also love the vegetarian egg rolls--they're unique in that they come with lettuce and pickled veggies to wrap around them--they're my favorite egg rolls I've ever had hands down!  Recommend this place highly!

Best pho in Mesa and great service. Make sure you try some of their special Pho's - while the traditional makes great comfort food, the S1 and S4 regional specialties are amazing.  I also love the Bun, especially the Bun bo Nuong (grilled beef), during the summer when I want something cooler and refreshing.  The tables are, for the most part, family style.  You may find yourself sitting next to someone you haven't met before.  Everything is clean and well maintained, and the staff and owner are friendly.

Sitting in the place where Pho Van once ran their business is this familiar face from Mesa.  Guys, it's unPhogettable's second location!  Gone are the tacky strings of light and up goes the vinyl bamboo decals you might recognize at their first location.  Everything is clean, everything is new, and the staff is nice.  It really is a breath of fresh air.  This location is just as solid as the Mekong Plaza location.  We got the Pho Dac Biet Bi Vien and had some Mi Thap Cam.  The broth for the pho isn't as light and clean as some other places but instead is full of meat flavor.  It feels heavy and I was definitely ready for a nap afterwards.  The noodles itself were springy and chewy.  As for the spring rolls and egg rolls, what can really be said?  They're all great.  UnPhogettable has always been in my Top 3 for pho in the valley.  They're not #1 but they make a solid pho.  I wish their second location much success!

Hands down one of my favorite place for Vietnamese food~  Owned by a lovely family, the service here is very friendly and very personal.  Through the owner's lovely wife, I learned how to drink Vietnamese coffee properly!  You may think that's a ridiculous thing to say but it was very motherly, sweet, and completely unnecessarily.  It's the fact that she took the time out to come over and teach me all the finer details of Vietnamese coffee that made the lesson and experience memorable.  Not even my Vietnamese friends had taken the time out to teach me!  Now the food here is truly unforgettable.  I love the bun by far!  It's crisp, fresh, and always leaves me full but not uncomfortably so.  I love their egg rolls and their spring rolls and the rice dishes are always savory and flavorful.    I must admit though there is probably only *one* other place I'd rather go to get pho over this place [because they're cheaper, just as delicious, and portions are just as big], I give this place one more star than the other because they're just sooo sweet and nice here!  The service really makes that one-star difference.  The prices here are a bit higher than other Vietnamese restaurants but the quality and freshness of the ingredients makes up for it.    With the modern decor, delicious food, and great service, what's not to love?

Truly unPhogettable but in a bad way.  We can't believe this place considers their items as Vietnamese food.   Ordered a special rice dish combo to go, they didn't give us the soup that came with it. When I asked for it they said "oh you wanted the soup?" Well, I paid for it didn't I? It's part of the combo isn't it?   Opened it when I got home and I was so disappointed. For close to $12 we were given the equivalent of cafeteria food.   "Thit Nuong" is supposed to be BBQ'd meat/pork. Cooked over an open flame, this seems microwaved. The veggies that came with it are lacking so much. You usually get red/green leaf lettuce at an authentic Viet place, here they search you iceberg, same with their springrolls.   I come from Santa Ana (Little Saigon) in Southern Cali. The worst spot there is 10 levels above this place.   The place right across from them is delicious. It costs about 10% more but they are indeed authentic and the food is genuine.   This place is the equivalent to Taco Bell for Mexican food.   They skimp on quality ingredients and serve food that barely qualifies as traditional Vietnamese.  If you want real authentic Pho and Viet food drive to Phoenix on 43rd st. There you will find the most amazing Vietnamese food and the cost is 25% - 35% less than this place.  There's a nice Viet place inside the food court there at Meekong plaza. They are $9 a dish and they do it right.  Please explore all your options. We will never eat here again.

Love love this place!!! It's a cute little place connected to a super market. It's clean and busy!! Great customer service! Everyone is super friendly and attentive! The portions of the pho are huge but it is so delicious ! The broth is so so yummy ! We also get the egg rolls that are so good too! Who knew shrimp and sausage would taste good together!?!

Worst service I've had in a long time. The waitress was snotty and literally couldn't do the basic math necessary for me to pay my bill (gave her a $20 bill and she sat there like 'um, 20 minus 12.44 is....uh....uh....'). Pho broth was overly salty. It took more than ten minutes to get my bill and I had to go up and ask for it. I will never, ever, go back.

I wouldn't say Unphogettable but it was very good. Service was great. I asked for a chicken broth with chicken and vegetables and there were no veggies but a piece of lettuce floating in there but...the flavor was awesome. My niece had the beef broth with brisket and nephew had one with seafood. We all really enjoyed our Pho.
Excellent!   Great spring rolls  Great Pho  Great service.   Its Photastic

I use to be a big fan of this place, but in the past year the Pho hasn't been tasting as good as it use to.  I have been eating a lot in the San Gabriel Valley in LA and they have alot of Pho restaurants and I think that's why I don't like this place anymore like I use to.  I will say, though, compared to many other Pho places in Arizona,  this is definitely one of the better ones.  It's also one of the more cleaner ones.  My friends that do cosplay love to meet here weekly love it.  For me, I prefer this Pho place over others in Arizona, but it's still never great compared to restaurants in LA.  The ones I always get is the #1 or #2 menu pho beef bowls.  I do really like the spring rolls, but they are different then normal ones because they use iceberg lettuce in it.   They have a really delicious peanut sauce that you can dip it with! :)    As for the sitting area, there are alot of places to sit and if you come on a weekend, it tends to be a little crowded.  The restaurant is clean and there is plenty of parking.  What's cool about it is that it is in indoor plaza where you can walk out and there is a Asian grocery store and other Asian giftshops.

This place is fine if you can tolerate the Pho-Nazi.  Under no circumstances, put anything in your pho; this includes Sirracha, hoisin sauce, chili sauce, etc.  The Pho-Nazi will be quick to point out the delicate texture, and full flavor of the broth, and how you are ruining it with your application of sauce.  Ok Pho-Nazi:  I am hung over, my eyes focus independantly, and everytime you speak, it sounds like a chainsaw buzzing in my ear.  I oblige you to make you go away.  Then I pour what I want in my pho.  Second attempt on this place was in fact not hung over.  I walked up to a packed restaurant, waited for 5 min. at the hostess stand, and then was waived off, waitress yelling across the crowded restaurant, "WE ARE CLOSED!"  Oh well I guess I didn't get the memo.  No posted hours on yelp, and no sign with hours.  Huh.  I guess I should have thought twice about putting sauce in my Pho.    TL;DR:  Don't piss off the Pho-Nazi, and your experience will be fine.

The Best for sure!  I have brought my AP Human Geography students for the last two years to enjoy this cultural experience.  The owner takes time out to explain the menu.  Its clean and just good.  I have yet to have a bad experience there.  I will always go to UnPhogettable.  I will always take my guests to UnPhogetable.  As should you!

This place is inside an Asian Marketplace and I wouldn't have found it if someone had not recommended it.   The owner, Chan, is really cool and friendly.   I ordered the house fried rice with extra "meat". He explained to me how really great fried rice is cooked by hearing it, rather than watching it. He said it had to "POP" like popcorn, and that's why theirs is really light and fluffy and NOT greasy at all. He was so right. Some of the best fried rice I've ever had.  I went again a few days later and got another order, it was that good. He recommended I order it next time with my choice of grilled meat on the side because it has it's own sauce and it caramelizes and it's so yummy.  Looking forward to trying more things here.   Bottom line though, good food plus friendly service is a win any day.

It takes an astounding restaurant to motivate me to login online to leave a review. This one definitely deserved it.  I've tried several Pho restaurants in the Phoenix/Tempe/Scottsdale area and this is the best one I've tried.   The Food is amazing, the staff is friendly, the location is always clean, the menu is not overpriced, the selection is great, and the food always comes out very fast. I always leave this restaurant impressed.   If your looking for a great pho experience this the best pick in town, no competition.

I decided to go with spring rolls and after going to a place in California called Brodard and enjoyin Spring Rolls in Vietnam, these were very okay.  It seems like it lacked some fresh ingredients when I tasted the components of the dish.  People seemed to enjoy the Pho, so I will try that next time.

I'm kind of sad to see bad reviews about this place. I fell inlove with it my first trip.  Let me start by saying I don't have much experience with Vietnamese cuisine, but my overall experience of unPhoGettable was fun.  The lack of appetizers do put a bit of a damper on the meal, but not a huge one. My boyfriend and I started off with the fried egg rolls. These were full of flavor and the lettuce I received was chilled, crisp (unlike the other reviewer) and was served with pickled veggies and a sweet sauce for dipping. I'm IN. The owner of the restaurant went over the entire menu for us, told us the most popular dishes and really pointed out the pros and cons of each dish. I went with the Pho w/ brisket. My boyfriend got the Pho with all the meats in there. It came with bean sprouts and basil on the side. I was stuffed by the time I left. I couldn't believe how much food was in that bowl. There was no way any one person can finish off a bowl of soup like that.   Give this little place a chance.

Came in with a party of 6 before the dinner rush. We had to wait a few minutes for seating, which is more than fine since we had more people. Everything started off great, water was given and orders taken. I am looking around and people are getting their food and appetizers. We waited 35 mins before ANYTHING came out. When the food came out only 4 bowls came out in which 1 was incorrect- one was sent back and they still needed clarification on what we all ordered. Second round, they brought out 2 more bowls of the correct order. I waited an addition 5 mins for my food to come out... and they gave me a kid bowl at this point, I was so hungry I didn't care and I told them to give it to me.  They only brought out 2 out of the 6 accoutrements (basil, sprouts, lime and jalapeño) until they were asked to bring out more. None of the pho bowls had cilantro or onion in it.   Not the mention while our party waited... an employee was walking around collecting hoisin and sriracha bottles and squirting/consolidating them in the seat next to me. The same employee fussed at another employee in Vietnamese for wiping down the table too much.   Service today was off... exceptionally off. Food was good, possibly because my stomach was eating itself.

Good service and even better Pho!  Large portions and very flavorful!  It's not often that Pho fills me up, but I left full after my meal!    Lucky for me that I reside nearby their sister location in Virginia Beach!

Not only was my Pho here unforgettable, it was no doubt pholicious! This particular Vietnamese dish is one of my all-time staples that I cannot live without!    As usual, I always order a bowl that includes "rare" steak, meatballs, and beef brisket while stuffing it with all the fresh veggies that normally comes with it, like the sprouts, Asian/mint leaves, and squeeze of lemon.  Interestingly, they did not have cilantro! Maybe they ran out? Hopefully that was the case, because it is a MUST! Lastly, I like to drizzle hoisin to give it a more rich sweet taste and the universal hot sauce that seriously can be put in just about anything, Siracha! Voila, I'm ready to slurp away!  The steak, meatballs and beef brisket were soft and tender, the way it always should be.  I thought the broth was quite good--the level of saltiness was balanced and tasted smooth. The broth is the key to a great Pho! if you do not agree, I would like to hear from you! :)  The noodles themselves, I thought were also really good actually.  I do not normally comment on the noodles because I always thought they tend to be "standard" and the same across the board.  Not in this case.  It was prepared perfectly and had an aromatic tasting hint to it--you do not want soggy noodles EVER!  I cannot go further without discussing the etiquettes of slurping Pho.  At this particular time, I happened to notice across me, two tables down to my left, a couple eating Pho, in probably the most bizarrest, unorthodox kind of way.  #1, who splits a Pho bowl?! To me that's a NO, NO.  To make this sound even more disturbing, they either slurped all the broth already or they dumped it out onto another bowl.  My good eyes saw that it looked like only the solid ingredients were left over.  Both people basically chopsticked their meat and noodles out onto their plate, A PLATE! Then, after that, they would examine their pieces of meat and it appeared like they were picking it apart or something and then devouring whatever they thought looked good???  To properly eat Pho, all you do is using either a fork or chopstick, grab your noodle and meat/veggies (bare minimum) and try to fit it into your Asian spoon.  After that's done, you may slurp away.  I like to take it a step further by also scooping the broth into the spoon so I can get the full taste.  For once, I have exhausted my brain and fingers typing this review. *sigh*
This is the best Pho in the valley. We drive 45 minutes to get here. We have been here many time & they never disappoint! Definitely recommend!

What a great place. I had the fried rice (by accident -- thought I'd pointed to the fried noodles, which I'll get next time). I'm a vegetarian, and there are plenty of veggie options. The fried rice was awesome with fried tofu and their hot sauce.  Highly recommend this place.

I came here twice for Pho and the food was delicious. The broth for the noodles was absolutely delicious with little to no grease. It is definitely one of the best in the east valley (in my opinion). However, waitresses are not very attentive and wish it would have been better. Nevertheless, I will still come back for the food and hope that their service will improve over time.
Food flavor is ok, service very good, portions very small, price higher.    Why 3 stars?, because The owners lately charge more and gives less portions.
Best Pho I've had! Fresh ingredients and broth and noodles just right.  Staff is very friendly and food comes out fast.
We had a great lunch.  The pho was very good, Bun Bao was superb, and the egg rolls very tasty.  I would return.
